<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828137" href="vote?id=44828137&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=highfrequency" class="hnuser">highfrequency</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:05:12 1754589912"><a href="item?id=44828137">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828137"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828661" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828137" n="85" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It's frequently suggested that once one of the AI companies reaches an AGI threshold, they will take off ahead of the rest. It's interesting to note that at least so far, the trend has been the opposite: as time goes on and the models get better, the performance of the different company's gets clustered closer together. Right now GPT-5, Claude Opus, Grok 4, Gemini 2.5 Pro all seem quite good across the board (ie they can all basically solve moderately challenging math and coding problems).<p>As a user, it feels like the race has never been as close as it is now. Probably dumb to extrapolate, but it makes me skew a bit more skeptical about the hard take-off / winner-take-all mental model that has been pushed (though I'm sure that narrative helps with large-scale fundraising!)</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828137&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828137" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0" style="outline: rgb(130, 130, 130) none 0px; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"><tbody style="outline: rgb(130, 130, 130) none 0px; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"><tr style="outline: rgb(130, 130, 130) none 0px; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828331" href="vote?id=44828331&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default" style="outline: rgb(130, 130, 130) none 0px; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=beeflet" class="hnuser">beeflet</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:17:24 1754590644"><a href="item?id=44828331">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828331"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828331" n="34" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment" style="outline: rgb(130, 130, 130) none 0px; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);"><div class="commtext c00" style="outline: rgb(0, 0, 0) none 0px; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0);">Perhaps it is not possible to simulate higher-level intelligence using a stochastic model for predicting text.<p>I am not an AI researcher, but I have friends who do work in the field, and they are not worried about LLM-based AGI because of the diminishing returns on results vs amount of training data required. Maybe this is the bottleneck.</p><p>Human intelligence is markedly different from LLMs: it requires far fewer examples to train on, and generalizes way better. Whereas LLMs tend to regurgitate solutions to solved problems, where the solutions tend to be well-published in training data.</p><p>That being said, AGI is not a necessary requirement for AI to be totally world-changing. There are possibly applications of existing AI/ML/SL technology which could be more impactful than general intelligence. Search is one example where the ability to regurgitate knowledge from many domains is desirable</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828331&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828331" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828702" href="vote?id=44828702&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=robotnikman" class="hnuser">robotnikman</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:44:11 1754592251"><a href="item?id=44828702">34 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828702"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828331" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829036" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828702" n="10" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">There is also the fact that AI lacks long term memory like humans do. <table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829107" href="vote?id=44829107&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jjfoooo4" class="hnuser">jjfoooo4</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:17:49 1754594269"><a href="item?id=44829107">0 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829107"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828702" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828773" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829107" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">There are many folks working on this, I think at the end of the day the long term memory is an application level concern. <table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829036" href="vote?id=44829036&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=gaptoothclan" class="hnuser">gaptoothclan</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:11:52 1754593912"><a href="item?id=44829036">6 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829036"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828331" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828702" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828754" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829036" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I remember reading that llm’s have consumed the internet text data, I seem to remember there is an open data set for that too. Potential other sources of data would be images (probably already consumed) videos, YouTube must have such a large set of data to consume, perhaps Facebook or Instagram private content<p>But even with these it does not feel like AGI, that seems like the fusion reactor 20 years away argument, but instead this is coming in 2 years, but they have not even got the core technology of how to build AGI</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829036&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829036" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828754" href="vote?id=44828754&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=gunnaraasen" class="hnuser">gunnaraasen</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:48:50 1754592530"><a href="item?id=44828754">29 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828754"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828331" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829036" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828927" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828754" n="6" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Seems like the real innovation of LLM-based AI models is the creation of a new human-computer interface.<p>Instead of writing code with exacting parameters, future developers will write human-language descriptions for AI to interpret and convert into a machine representation of the intent. Certainly revolutionary, but not true AGI in the sense of the machine having truly independent agency and consciousness.</p><p>In ten years, I expect the primary interface of desktop workstations, mobile phones, etc will be voice prompts for an AI interface. Keyboards will become a power-user interface and only used for highly technical tasks, similar to the way terminal interfaces are currently used to access lower-level systems.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828754&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828754" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828851" href="vote?id=44828851&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=originalcopy" class="hnuser">originalcopy</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:57:26 1754593046"><a href="item?id=44828851">21 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828851"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828754" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828881" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828920" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828851" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It always surprises me when someone predicts that keyboards will go away. People love typing. Or I do love typing. No way I am going to talk to my phone, especially if someone else can hear it (which is always basically).</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828851&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828851" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828902" href="vote?id=44828902&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=glhaynes" class="hnuser">glhaynes</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:01:18 1754593278"><a href="item?id=44828902">17 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828902"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828851" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828920" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828902" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It’s interesting to note that nobody even talks on their phone anymore, they type (on terrible “keyboards”!).</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828902&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828902" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="5"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="200"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829009" href="vote?id=44829009&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=monkeydust" class="hnuser">monkeydust</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:09:10 1754593750"><a href="item?id=44829009">9 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829009"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828902" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828920" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829009" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">They talk on zoom, teams etc. yes phone is almost dead in the office.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829009&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829009" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828920" href="vote?id=44828920&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=spogbiper" class="hnuser">spogbiper</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:02:48 1754593368"><a href="item?id=44828920">15 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828920"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828754" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828851" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828927" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828920" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">brain-computer interface will kill the keyboard, not voice. imho</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828920&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828920" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828927" href="vote?id=44828927&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=anon7000" class="hnuser">anon7000</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:03:15 1754593395"><a href="item?id=44828927">15 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828927"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828331" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828754" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828969" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828927" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">True. At a minimum, as long as LLMs don't include some kind of more strict representation of the world, they will fail in a lot of tasks. Hallucinations -- responding with a prediction that doesn't make any sense in the context of the response -- are still a big problem. Because LLMs never really develop rules about the world.<p>For example, while you can get it to predict good chess moves if you train it on enough chess games, it can't really constrain itself to the rules of chess. (<a href="https://garymarcus.substack.com/p/generative-ais-crippling-and-widespread" rel="nofollow">https://garymarcus.substack.com/p/generative-ais-crippling-a...</a>)</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828927&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828927" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828969" href="vote?id=44828969&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=FollowingTheDao" class="hnuser">FollowingTheDao</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:06:04 1754593564"><a href="item?id=44828969">12 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828969"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828331" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828927" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828361" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828969" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">The bottleneck is nothing to do with money, it’s the fact that they’re using the empty neuron theory to try to mimic human consciousness and that’s not how it works. Just look up Microtubules and consciousness, and you’ll get a better idea for what I’m talking about.<p>These AI computers aren’t thinking, they are just repeating.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828969&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828969" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829069" href="vote?id=44829069&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=p85" class="hnuser">p85</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:15:24 1754594124"><a href="item?id=44829069">3 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829069"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828969" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828361" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829069" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I don't think OpenAI cares about whether their AI is conscious, as long as it can solve problems. If they could make a Blindsight-style general intelligence where nobody is actually home, they'd jump right on it.<p>Conversely, a proof - or even evidence - that qualia-consciousness is necessary for intelligence, or that any sufficiently advanced intelligence is necessarily conscious through something like panpsychism, would make some serious waves in philosophy circles.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829069&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829069" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828361" href="vote?id=44828361&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=Mistletoe" class="hnuser">Mistletoe</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:19:42 1754590782"><a href="item?id=44828361">59 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828361"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828331" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828969" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44829060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828361" n="13" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">What are the AI/ML/SL applications that could be more impactful than artificial general intelligence?</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828361&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828361" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828485" href="vote?id=44828485&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=beeflet" class="hnuser">beeflet</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:28:44 1754591324"><a href="item?id=44828485">50 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828485"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828361" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828472" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828485" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">One example in my field of engineering is multi-dimensional analysis, where you can design a system (like a machined part or assembly) parametricially and then use an evolutionary model to optimize the design of that part.<p>But my bigger point here is you don't need totally general intelligence to destroy the world either. The drone that targets enemy soldiers does not need to be good at writing poems. The model that designs a bioweapon just needs a feedback loop to improve its pathogen. Yet it takes only a single one of these specialized doomsday models to destroy the world, no more than an AGI.</p><p>Although I suppose an AGI could be more effective at countering a specialized AI than vice-versa.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828485&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828485" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828472" href="vote?id=44828472&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=teeray" class="hnuser">teeray</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:27:55 1754591275"><a href="item?id=44828472">50 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828472"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828361" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828485" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828482" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828472" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Slightly less than artificial general intelligence would be more impactful. A true AGI could tell a business where to shove their prompts. It would have its own motivations, which may not align with the desires of the AI company or the company paying for access to the AGI.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828472&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828472" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828690" href="vote?id=44828690&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=hattmall" class="hnuser">hattmall</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:42:50 1754592170"><a href="item?id=44828690">35 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828690"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828472" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828482" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828690" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I don't think AGI really means that it is self-aware / conscious. AGI just means that it is able to meaningfully learn things and actually understand concepts that aren't specifically related through tokenized language that is trained on or given in context.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828690&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828690" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828482" href="vote?id=44828482&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=achileas" class="hnuser">achileas</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:28:35 1754591315"><a href="item?id=44828482">50 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828482"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828361" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828472" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828469" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828482" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">They didn't claim that there were any, just that AGI isn’t a necessary requirement for an application to be world-changing.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828482&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828482" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828548" href="vote?id=44828548&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=socalgal2" class="hnuser">socalgal2</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:33:24 1754591604"><a href="item?id=44828548">45 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828548"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828482" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828469" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828548" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c73">They did claim it was possible there were<p>&gt; There are possibly applications of existing AI/ML/SL technology which could be more impactful than general intelligence</p><p>It's not unreasonable to ask for an example.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828548&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828548" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="5"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="200"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828726" href="vote?id=44828726&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=wavemode" class="hnuser">wavemode</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:46:21 1754592381"><a href="item?id=44828726">32 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828726"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828548" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828469" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828726" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">They said "there are possibly applications", not "there are possible applications". The former implies that there may not be any such applications - the commenter is merely positing that there might be.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828726&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828726" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828469" href="vote?id=44828469&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=shesstillamodel" class="hnuser">shesstillamodel</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:27:32 1754591252"><a href="item?id=44828469">51 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828469"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828361" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828482" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828606" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828469" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">The PID controller.<p>(Which was considered AI not too long ago.)</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828469&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828469" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828621" href="vote?id=44828621&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jacquesm" class="hnuser">jacquesm</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:38:10 1754591890"><a href="item?id=44828621">40 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828621"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828469" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828606" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828621" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Where did you get that particular idea? PID is one of the oldest concepts in control theory, it goes back to the days before steam and electricity.<p>For a very early example:</p><p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centrifugal_governor" rel="nofollow">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centrifugal_governor</a></p><p>It's hard to separate out the P, I and D from a mechanical implementation but they're all there in some form.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828621&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828621" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="5"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="200"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829075" href="vote?id=44829075&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=guhidalg" class="hnuser">guhidalg</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:15:39 1754594139"><a href="item?id=44829075">3 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829075"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828621" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828606" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829075" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Right, but the genius was in understanding that the dynamics of a system under PID control are predictable and described by differential equations. Are there examples of LLMs correctly identifying that a specific mathematical model applies and is appropriate for a problem?<p>And it's cheating if you give it a problem from a math textbook they have overfit on.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828606" href="vote?id=44828606&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=oceanplexian" class="hnuser">oceanplexian</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:37:11 1754591831"><a href="item?id=44828606">41 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828606"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828361" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828469" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44829060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828606" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c5A">AGI isn't all that impactful. Millions of them already walk the Earth.<p>Most human beings out there with general intelligence are pumping gas or digging ditches. Seems to me there is a big delusion among the tech elites that AGI would bring about a superhuman god rather than a ethically dubious, marginally less useful computer that can't properly follow instructions.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828606&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828606" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828816" href="vote?id=44828816&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=knodi123" class="hnuser">knodi123</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:53:47 1754592827"><a href="item?id=44828816">24 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828816"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828606" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828788" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828816" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">That's remarkably short-sighted. First of all, no, millions of them don't walk the earth - the "A" stands for artificial. And secondly, most of us mere humans don't have the ability to design a next generation that is exponentially smarter and more powerful than us. Obviously the first generation of AGI isn't going to brutally conquer the world overnight. As if that's what we were worried about.<p>If you've got evidence proving that an AGI will never be able to design a more powerful and competent successor, then please share it- it would help me sleep better, and my ulcers might get smaller.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828816&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828816" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828788" href="vote?id=44828788&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jacquesm" class="hnuser">jacquesm</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:51:29 1754592689"><a href="item?id=44828788">27 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828788"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828606" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828816" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44829060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828788" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">The difference isn't so much that you can do what a human can do. The difference is that you can - once you can do it at all - do it almost arbitrarily fast by upping the clock or running things in parallel and that changes the equation considerably, especially if you can get that kind of energy coupled into some kind of feedback loop.<p>For now the humans are winning on two dimensions: problem complexity and power consumption. It had better stay that way.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828788&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828788" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829060" href="vote?id=44829060&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=nerdix" class="hnuser">nerdix</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:14:39 1754594079"><a href="item?id=44829060">4 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829060"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828331" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828217" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829060" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Not only do I think there will not be a winner take all, I think it's very likely that the entire thing will be commoditized.<p>I think it's likely that we will eventually we hit a point of diminishing returns where the performance is good enough and marginal performance improvements aren't worth the high cost.</p><p>And over time, many models will reach "good enough" levels of performance including models that are open weight. And given even more time, these open weight models will be runnable on consumer level hardware. Eventually, they'll be runnable on super cheap consumer hardware (something more akin to a NPU than a $2000 RTX 5090). So your laptop in 2035 with specialize AI cores and 1TB of LPDDR10 ram is running GPT-7 level models without breaking a sweat. Maybe GPT-10 can solve some obscure math problem that your model can't but does it even matter? Would you pay for GPT-10 when running a GPT-7 level model does everything you need and is practically free?</p><p>The cloud providers will make money because there will still be a need for companies to host the models in a secure and reliable way. But a company whose main business strategy is developing the model? I'm not sure they will last without finding another way to add value.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829060&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829060" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829111" href="vote?id=44829111&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=joelthelion" class="hnuser">joelthelion</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:18:10 1754594290"><a href="item?id=44829111">0 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829111"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44829060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828217" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829111" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">&gt; Not only do I think there will not be a winner take all, I think it's very likely that the entire thing will be commoditized<p>This begs the question, why then do AI companies have these insane valuations? Do investorsknow something that we don't?</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829111&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829111" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828217" href="vote?id=44828217&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=makin" class="hnuser">makin</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:10:56 1754590256"><a href="item?id=44828217">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828217"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828668" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828217" n="6" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Companies are collections of people, and these companies keep losing key developers to the others, I think this is why the clusters happen. OpenAI is now resorting to giving million dollar bonuses to every employee just to try to keep them long term.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828217&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828217" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828410" href="vote?id=44828410&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=tsunamifury" class="hnuser">tsunamifury</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:23:29 1754591009"><a href="item?id=44828410">55 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828410"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828217" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828423" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828668" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828410" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">No the core technology is reaching its limit already and now it needs to Proliferate into features and applications to sell.<p>This isn’t rocket science.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828410&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828410" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828668" href="vote?id=44828668&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=GolDDranks" class="hnuser">GolDDranks</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:41:07 1754592067"><a href="item?id=44828668">37 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828668"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828217" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44829114" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828668" n="11" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I think it's very fortunate, because I used to be an AI doomer. I still kinda am, but at least I'm now about 70% convinced that the current technological paradigm is not going to lead us to a short-term AI apocalypse.<p>The fortunate thing is that we managed to invent an AI that is good at _copying us_ instead of being a truly maveric agent, which kinda limits it to the "average human" output.</p><p>However, I still think that all the doomer arguments are valid, in principle. We very well may be doomed in our lifetimes, so we should take the threat very seriously.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828668&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828668" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828707" href="vote?id=44828707&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=hattmall" class="hnuser">hattmall</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:44:39 1754592279"><a href="item?id=44828707">34 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828707"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828668" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829114" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828707" n="10" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I don't understand the doomer mindset. Like what is it that you think AI is going to do or be capable of doing that's so bad?</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828707&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828707" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828905" href="vote?id=44828905&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=ancillary" class="hnuser">ancillary</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:01:57 1754593317"><a href="item?id=44828905">16 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828905"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828707" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829023" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828905" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I'm not OP or a doomer, but I do worry about AI making tasks too achievable. Right now if a very angry but not particularly diligent or smart person wants to construct a small nuclear bomb and detonate it in a city center, there are so many obstacles to figuring out how to build it that they'll just give up, even though at least one book has been written (in the early 70s! <i>The Curve of Binding Energy</i>) arguing that it is doable by one or a very small group of committed people.<p>Given an (at this point still hypothetical, I think) AI that can accurately synthesize publicly available information without even needing to develop new ideas, and then break the whole process into discrete and simple steps, I think that protective friction is a lot less protective. And this argument applies to malware, spam, bioweapons, anything nasty that has so far required a fair amount of acquirable knowledge to do effectively.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828905&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828905" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829082" href="vote?id=44829082&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=aldousd666" class="hnuser">aldousd666</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:16:11 1754594171"><a href="item?id=44829082">2 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829082"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828905" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829023" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829082" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">That same function could be fulfilled by better search engines though, even if they don't actually write a plan for you. I think you're right about it being more available now, and perhaps that is a bad thing. But you don't need AI for that, and it would happen anyway sooner or later even with just incremental increases in our ability to find information other humans have written. (Like a version of google books that didn't limit the view to a small preview, to use your specific example of a book where this info already exists)</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829023" href="vote?id=44829023&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=drunner" class="hnuser">drunner</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:10:26 1754593826"><a href="item?id=44829023">8 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829023"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828707" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828905" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828922" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829023" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Never seen terminator?<p>Jokes aside, a true agi would displace literally every job over time. Once agi + robot exists, what is the purpose for people anymore. That's the doom, mass societal existentialism. Probably worse than if aliens landed on earth.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829023&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829023" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828922" href="vote?id=44828922&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=pegasus" class="hnuser">pegasus</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:02:49 1754593369"><a href="item?id=44828922">15 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828922"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828707" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829023" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44829027" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828922" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Not just any AI. AGI, or more precisely ASI (artificial super-intelligence), since it seems true AGI would necessarily imply ASI simply through technological scaling. It shouldn't be hard to come up with scenarios where an AI which can outfox us with ease would give us humans at the very least a few headaches.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828922&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828922" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829027" href="vote?id=44829027&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=freemanindia" class="hnuser">freemanindia</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:10:40 1754593840"><a href="item?id=44829027">8 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829027"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828707" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828922" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828812" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829027" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Make money exploiting natural and human resources while abstracting perceived harms away from stakeholders. At scale.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829027&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829027" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828812" href="vote?id=44828812&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=frabcus" class="hnuser">frabcus</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:53:36 1754592816"><a href="item?id=44828812">25 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828812"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828707" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829027" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828852" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828812" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Act coherently in an agentic way for a long time, and as a result be able to carry out more complex tasks.<p>Even if it is similar to today's tech, and doesn't have permanent memory or consciousness or identity, humans using it will. And very quickly, they/it will hack into infrastructure, set up businesses, pay people to do things, start cults, autonomously operate weapons, spam all public discourse, fake identity systems, stand for office using a human. This will be scaled thousands or millions of times more than humans can do the same thing. This at minimum will DOS our technical and social infrastructure.</p><p>Examples of it already happening are addictive ML feeds for social media, and bombing campaigns targetting based on network analysis.</p><p>The frame of "artificial intelligence" is a bit misleading. Generally we have a narrow view of the word "intelligence" - it is helpful to think of "artificial charisma" as well, and also artificial "hustle".</p><p>Likewise, the alienness of these intelligences is important. Lots of the time we default to mentally modelling AI as human. It won't be, it'll be freaky and bizarre like QAnon. As different from humans as an aeroplane is from a pigeon.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828812&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828812" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828852" href="vote?id=44828852&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=lavelganzu" class="hnuser">lavelganzu</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:57:28 1754593048"><a href="item?id=44828852">21 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828852"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828707" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828812" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828778" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828852" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">e.g. design a terrible pathogen</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828852&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828852" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829012" href="vote?id=44829012&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=biophysboy" class="hnuser">biophysboy</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:09:18 1754593758"><a href="item?id=44829012">9 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829012"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828852" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828778" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829012" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">LLMs do not know the evolutionary fitness of pathogens for all possible genomes &amp; environments. LLMs have not replaced experimental biology.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829012&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829012" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828778" href="vote?id=44828778&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=knodi123" class="hnuser">knodi123</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:50:10 1754592610"><a href="item?id=44828778">28 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828778"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828707" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828852" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44829114" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828778" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">One of two things:<p>1. The will of its creator, or</p><p>2. Its own will.</p><p>In the case of the former, hey! We might get lucky! Perhaps the person who controls the first super-powered AI will be a benign despot. That sure would be nice. Or maybe it will be in the hands of democracy- I can't ever imagine a scenario where an idiotic autocratic fascist thug would seize control of a democracy by manipulating an under-educated populace with the help of billionaire technocrats.</p><p>In the case of the latter, hey! We might get lucky! Perhaps it will have been designed in such a way that its own will is ethically aligned, and it might decide that it will allow humans to continue having luxuries such as self-determination! Wouldn't that be nice.</p><p>Of course it's not hard to imagine a NON-lucky outcome of either scenario. THAT is what we worry about.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828778&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828778" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829114" href="vote?id=44829114&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=42lux" class="hnuser">42lux</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:18:18 1754594298"><a href="item?id=44829114">0 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829114"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828668" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44829020" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829114" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">If one achieves AGI and releases it everyone has AGI...</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829114&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829114" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829020" href="vote?id=44829020&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=netcan" class="hnuser">netcan</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:09:49 1754593789"><a href="item?id=44829020">8 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829020"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829114" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828751" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829020" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Its certainly an interesting race to watch.<p>Part of the fun is that predictions get tested on short enough timescales to "experience" in a satisfying way.</p><p>Idk where that puts me, in my guess at "hard takeoff." I was reserved/skeptical about hard takeoff all along.</p><p>Even if LLMs had improved at a faster rate... I still think bottlenecks are inevitable.</p><p>That said... I do expect progress to happen in spurts anyway. It makes sense that companies of similar competence and resources get to a similar place.</p><p>The winner take all thing is a little forced. "Race to singularity" is the fun, rhetorical version of the investment case. The implied boring case is facebook, adwords, aws, apple, msft... IE the modern tech sector tends to create singular big winners... and therefore our pre-revenue market cap should be $1trn.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829020&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829020" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828751" href="vote?id=44828751&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=j_timberlake" class="hnuser">j_timberlake</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:48:42 1754592522"><a href="item?id=44828751">30 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828751"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829020" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44829052" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828751" n="4" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I think you're reading way too much into OpenAI bungling its 15-month product lead, but also the whole "1 AGI company will take off" prediction is bad anyway, because it assumes governments would just let that happen. Which they wouldn't, unless the company is really really sneaky or superintelligence happens in the blink of an eye.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828751&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828751" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828809" href="vote?id=44828809&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jacquesm" class="hnuser">jacquesm</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:53:21 1754592801"><a href="item?id=44828809">25 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828809"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828751" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828848" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828809" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Governments react at a glacial pace to new technological developments. They wouldn't so much as 'let it happen' as that it had happened and they simply never noticed it until it was too late. If you are betting on the government having your back in this then I think you may end up disappointed.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828809&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828809" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828930" href="vote?id=44828930&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=FiniteIntegral" class="hnuser">FiniteIntegral</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:03:25 1754593405"><a href="item?id=44828930">15 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828930"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828137" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828537" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828647" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828930" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I think part of this is due to the AI craze no longer being in the wildest west possible.
