<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828476" href="vote?id=44828476&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=diegocg" class="hnuser">diegocg</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:28:05 1754591285"><a href="item?id=44828476">50 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828476"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827929" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828345" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828509" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828446" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828476" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I wonder if it would even be helpful because they avoid the increasing AI content</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828476&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828476" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828446" href="vote?id=44828446&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=LeoPanthera" class="hnuser">LeoPanthera</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:26:11 1754591171"><a href="item?id=44828446">52 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828446"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827929" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828345" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828705" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828446" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Gemini does cursory web searches for almost every query, presumably to fill in the gap between the knowledge cutoff and now.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828446&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828446" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828705" href="vote?id=44828705&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=archon810" class="hnuser">archon810</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:44:25 1754592265"><a href="item?id=44828705">34 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828705"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827929" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828446" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828369" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828705" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">And GPT-5 nano and mini cutoff is even earlier - May 30 2024.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828705&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828705" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828369" href="vote?id=44828369&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=breadwinner" class="hnuser">breadwinner</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:20:27 1754590827"><a href="item?id=44828369">58 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828369"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827929" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828705" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828455" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828369" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">That could means OpenAI does not take any shortcuts when it comes to safety.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828369&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828369" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828455" href="vote?id=44828455&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=lurking_swe" class="hnuser">lurking_swe</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:26:52 1754591212"><a href="item?id=44828455">51 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828455"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827929" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828369" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44829109" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828455" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">the model can do web search so this is mostly irrelevant i think.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828455&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828455" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829109" href="vote?id=44829109&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=ftkftk" class="hnuser">ftkftk</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:18:06 1754594286"><a href="item?id=44829109">0 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829109"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827929" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828914" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829109" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Answer in one word: Underwhelming.<p>Bad data on graphs, demos that would have been impressive a year ago, vibe coding the easiest requests (financial dashboard), running out of talking points while cursor is looping on a bug, marginal benchmark improvements. At least the models are kind of cheaper to run.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829109&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829109" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828914" href="vote?id=44828914&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=m4nu3l" class="hnuser">m4nu3l</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:02:17 1754593337"><a href="item?id=44828914">16 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828914"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44829109" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828914" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Very funny. The very first answer it gave to illustrate its "Expert knowledge" is quite common, and it's wrong. What's even funnier is that you can find why on Wikipedia: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lift_(force)#False_explanation_based_on_equal_transit-time" rel="nofollow">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lift_(force)#False_explanation...</a> What's terminally funny is that in the visualisation app, it used a symmetric wing, which of course wouldn't generate lift according to its own explanation (as the travelled distance and hence air flow speed would be the same). I work as a game physics programmer, so I noticed that immediately and almost laughed. I watched only that part so far while I was still at the office, though.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828914&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828914" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827088" href="vote?id=44827088&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=minimaxir" class="hnuser">minimaxir</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:05:58 1754586358"><a href="item?id=44827088">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827088"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828914" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827088" n="39" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">The marketing copy and the current livestream appear tautological: "it's better because it's better."<p>Not much explanation yet why GPT-5 warrants a major version bump. As usual, the model (and potentially OpenAI as a whole) will depend on output vibe checks.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827088&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827088" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827352" href="vote?id=44827352&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=pram" class="hnuser">pram</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:19:26 1754587166"><a href="item?id=44827352">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827352"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827159" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827352" n="23" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">We’re at the audiophile stage of LLMs where people are talking about the improved soundstage, tonality, reduced sibilance etc</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827352&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827352" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="5"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="200"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828103" href="vote?id=44828103&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=riknos314" class="hnuser">riknos314</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:03:38 1754589818"><a href="item?id=44828103">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828103"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827768" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828289" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828103" n="4" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">This is and isn't true.<p>The room is the limiting factor in most speaker setups. The worse the room, the sooner you hit diminishing returns for upgrading any other part of the system.</p><p>In a fantastic room a $50 speaker will be nowhere near 95% of the performance of a mastering monitor, no matter how much EQ you put on it. In the average living room with less than ideal speaker and listening position placement there will still be a difference, but it will be much less apparent due to the limitations of the listening environment.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828103&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828103" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="6"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="240"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828387" href="vote?id=44828387&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jpc0" class="hnuser">jpc0</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:21:37 1754590897"><a href="item?id=44828387">57 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828387"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828103" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828131" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828387" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Absolutely not true.<p>You might lose headroom or have to live with higher latency but if your complaint is about actual empirical data like frequency response or phase, that can be corrected digitally.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828387&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828387" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="7"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="280"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828827" href="vote?id=44828827&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=babypuncher" class="hnuser">babypuncher</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:54:58 1754592898"><a href="item?id=44828827">23 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828827"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828387" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828131" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828827" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">You can only EQ speakers and headphones as far as the transducer can still respond accurately to the signal you're sending it. No amount of EQ will give the Sennheiser HD-600's good sub-bass performance because the driver begins to distort the signal long before you've amplified it enough to match the Harman target at a normal listening level.<p>DSP is a very powerful tool that can make terrible speakers and headphones sound great, but it's not magic.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828827&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828827" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827880" href="vote?id=44827880&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=some-guy" class="hnuser">some-guy</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:51:03 1754589063"><a href="item?id=44827880">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827880"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827627" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827460" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827880" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">As someone who tries to push the limits of hard coding tasks (mainly refactoring old codebases) to LLMs with not much improvement since the last round of models, I'm finding that we are hitting the reduction of rate of improvement on the S-curve of quality. Obviously getting the same quality cheaper would be huge, but the quality of the output day to day isn't noticeable to me.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827880&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827880" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828567" href="vote?id=44828567&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=camdenreslink" class="hnuser">camdenreslink</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:34:20 1754591660"><a href="item?id=44828567">44 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828567"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827880" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827460" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828567" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I find it struggles to even refactor codebases that aren't that large. If you have a somewhat complicated change that spans the full stack, and has some sort of wrinkle that makes it slightly more complicated than adding a data field, then even the most modern LLMs seem to trip on themselves. Even when I tell it to create a plan for implementation and write it to a markdown file and then step through those steps in a separate prompt.<p>Not that it makes it useless, just that we seem to not "be there" yet for the standard tasks software engineers do every day.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828567&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828567" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827460" href="vote?id=44827460&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=scosman" class="hnuser">scosman</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:26:38 1754587598"><a href="item?id=44827460">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827460"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827880" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828415" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827460" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">There's a bunch of benchmarks on the intro page including AIME 2025 without tools, SWE-bench Verified, Aider Polyglot, MMMU, and HealthBench Hard (not familiar with this one): <a href="https://openai.com/index/introducing-gpt-5/" rel="nofollow">https://openai.com/index/introducing-gpt-5/</a><p>Pretty par for course evals at launch setup.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827460&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827460" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

We're entered the Smartphone stage: "You want the new one because it's the new one."</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828415&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828415" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827716" href="vote?id=44827716&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=thegeomaster" class="hnuser">thegeomaster</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:41:50 1754588510"><a href="item?id=44827716">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827716"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827160" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827716" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">o3 pricing: $8/Mtok out<p>GPT-5 pricing: $10/Mtok out</p><p>What am I missing?</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827716&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827716" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828717" href="vote?id=44828717&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=throwaway0123_5" class="hnuser">throwaway0123_5</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:45:11 1754592311"><a href="item?id=44828717">33 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828717"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827716" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827971" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828717" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It seems like you might need less output tokens for the same quality of response though. One of their plots shows o3 needing ~14k tokens to get 69% on SWE-bench Verified, but GPT-5 needing only ~4k.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828717&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828717" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827971" href="vote?id=44827971&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=anthonypasq" class="hnuser">anthonypasq</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:56:31 1754589391"><a href="item?id=44827971">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827971"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827716" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828717" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827971" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">pretty sure reduced cache input pricing is a pretty big deal for reasoning models, but im not positive</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827971&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827971" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827154" href="vote?id=44827154&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=doctoboggan" class="hnuser">doctoboggan</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:08:59 1754586539"><a href="item?id=44827154">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827154"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827154" n="27" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Watching the livestream now, the improvement over their current models on the benchmarks is very small. I know they seemed to be trying to temper our expectations leading up to this, but this is much less improvement than I was expecting</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827154&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827154" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828017" href="vote?id=44828017&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=827a" class="hnuser">827a</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:59:03 1754589543"><a href="item?id=44828017">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828017"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827548" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828017" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I have a suspicion that while the major AI companies have been pretty samey and competing in the same space for a while now, the market is going to force them to differentiate a bit, and we're going to see OpenAI begin to lose the race toward extremely high levels of intelligence instead choosing to focus on justifying their valuations by optimizing cost and for conversational/normal intelligence/personal assistant use-cases. After all, most of their users just want to use it to cheat at school, get relationship advice, and write business emails. They also have Ive's company to continue investing in.<p>Meanwhile, Anthropic &amp; Google have more room in their P/S ratios to continue to spend effort on logarithmic intelligence gains.</p><p>Doesn't mean we won't see more and more intelligent models out of OpenAI, especially in the o-series, but at some point you have to make payroll and reality hits.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828017&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828017" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828344" href="vote?id=44828344&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=juped" class="hnuser">juped</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:18:33 1754590713"><a href="item?id=44828344">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828344"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828017" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827548" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828344" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I think this is pretty much what we've already seen happening, in fact.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828344&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828344" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827548" href="vote?id=44827548&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=z7" class="hnuser">z7</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:31:12 1754587872"><a href="item?id=44827548">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827548"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828017" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828804" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827548" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">GPT-5 is #1 on WebDev Arena with +75 pts over Gemini 2.5 Pro and +100 pts over Claude Opus 4:<p><a href="https://lmarena.ai/leaderboard" rel="nofollow">https://lmarena.ai/leaderboard</a></p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827548&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827548" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828804" href="vote?id=44828804&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=hodgehog11" class="hnuser">hodgehog11</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:53:03 1754592783"><a href="item?id=44828804">25 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828804"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827548" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828215" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828804" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">The hallucination benchmarks did show major improvement. <table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829043" href="vote?id=44829043&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jama211" class="hnuser">jama211</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:12:22 1754593942"><a href="item?id=44829043">6 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829043"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828804" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828215" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829043" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I’m more worried about how they still confidently reason through things incorrectly all the time, which isn’t quite the same as hallucination, but it’s in a similar vein.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829043&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829043" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827661" href="vote?id=44827661&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=Workaccount2" class="hnuser">Workaccount2</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:39:33 1754588373"><a href="item?id=44827661">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827661"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828215" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827322" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827661" n="9" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Sam said maybe two years ago that they want to avoid "mic drop" releases, and instead want to stick to incremental steps.<p>This is day one, so there is probably another 10-20% in optimizations that can be squeezed out of it in the coming months.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827661&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827661" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827312" href="vote?id=44827312&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=lawlessone" class="hnuser">lawlessone</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:17:47 1754587067"><a href="item?id=44827312">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827312"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827500" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827312" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">im sure i am repeating someone else but sounds like we're coming over the s-curve</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827312&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827312" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827423" href="vote?id=44827423&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=Bluestein" class="hnuser">Bluestein</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:24:15 1754587455"><a href="item?id=44827423">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827423"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827312" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827423" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">My thought exactly.-<p>Diminished returns.-</p><p>... here's hoping it leads to progress.-</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827423&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827423" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827498" href="vote?id=44827498&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=kybernetikos" class="hnuser">kybernetikos</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:28:18 1754587698"><a href="item?id=44827498">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827498"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827154" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827304" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827498" n="80" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">ChatGPT5 in this demo:<p>&gt; For an airplane wing (airfoil), the top surface is curved and the bottom is flatter. When the wing moves forward:</p><p>&gt; * Air over the top has to travel farther in the same amount of time -&gt; it moves faster -&gt; pressure on the top decreases.</p><p>&gt; * Air underneath moves slower -&gt; pressure underneath is higher</p><p>&gt; * The presure difference creates an upward force - lift</p><p>Isn't that explanation of why wings work completely wrong? There's nothing that forces the air to cover the top distance in the same time that it covers the bottom distance, and in fact it doesn't. <a href="https://www.cam.ac.uk/research/news/how-wings-really-work" rel="nofollow">https://www.cam.ac.uk/research/news/how-wings-really-work</a></p><p>Very strange to use a mistake as your first demo, especially while talking about how it's phd level.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827498&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827498" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827735" href="vote?id=44827735&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=peterdsharpe" class="hnuser">peterdsharpe</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:43:03 1754588583"><a href="item?id=44827735">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827735"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828607" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827735" n="28" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Yes, it is completely wrong. If this were a valid explanation, flat-plate airfoils could not generate lift. (They can.)<p>Source: PhD on aircraft design</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827735&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827735" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828277" href="vote?id=44828277&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=timr" class="hnuser">timr</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:14:11 1754590451"><a href="item?id=44828277">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828277"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827735" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828023" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828277" n="10" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Except it isn't "completely wrong". The article the OP links to says it explicitly:<p>&gt; “What actually causes lift is introducing a shape into the airflow, which curves the streamlines and introduces pressure changes – lower pressure on the upper surface and higher pressure on the lower surface,” clarified Babinsky, from the Department of Engineering. “This is why a flat surface like a sail is able to cause lift – here the distance on each side is the same but it is slightly curved when it is rigged and so it acts as an aerofoil. In other words, it’s the curvature that creates lift, not the distance.”</p><p>The meta-point that "it's the curvature that creates the lift, not the distance" is <i>incredibly subtle</i> for a lay audience. So it may be completely wrong for you, but not for 99.9% of the population. The pressure differential is important, and the curvature does create lift, although not via speed differential.</p><p>I am far from an AI hypebeast, but this subthread feels like people reaching for a criticism.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828277&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828277" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829054" href="vote?id=44829054&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=boombapoom" class="hnuser">boombapoom</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:13:34 1754594014"><a href="item?id=44829054">5 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829054"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828277" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828334" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829054" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">except we were promised to have "PHDs in our pocket" which would mean that this falls short on the sales expectations...</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829054&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829054" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828334" href="vote?id=44828334&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=ttoinou" class="hnuser">ttoinou</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:17:42 1754590662"><a href="item?id=44828334">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828334"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828277" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829054" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828560" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828334" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I would say a wing with two sides of different length is more difficult to understand than one shape with two sides of opposites curvatures but same length</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828334&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828334" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828560" href="vote?id=44828560&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=avs733" class="hnuser">avs733</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:34:11 1754591651"><a href="item?id=44828560">44 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828560"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828277" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828334" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828349" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828560" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">the wrongness isn't germane to most people but it is a specific typology of how LLMs get technica lthings wrong that is critically important to progressing them. It gets subtle things wrongby being biased towards lay understandings that introduce vagueness because greater precision isn't useful.<p>That doesn't matter for lay audieces and doesn't really matter at all until we try and use them for technical things.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828560&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828560" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828742" href="vote?id=44828742&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=kybernetikos" class="hnuser">kybernetikos</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:47:42 1754592462"><a href="item?id=44828742">31 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828742"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828560" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828680" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828742" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">The wrongness is germane to someone who is doing their physics homework (the example given here). It's actually difficult for me to imagine a situation where someone would ask ChatGPT 5 for information about this and it not be germane if ChatGPT 5 gave an incorrect explanation.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828742&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828742" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828680" href="vote?id=44828680&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=timr" class="hnuser">timr</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:42:14 1754592134"><a href="item?id=44828680">36 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828680"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828560" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828742" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828349" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828680" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I grant your broader point, but extrapolating from this marketing copy is not a great example.<p>The <i>real</i> question is, if you go back to the bot following this conversation and you challenge it, does it generate the more correct answer?</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828680&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828680" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828349" href="vote?id=44828349&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=carabiner" class="hnuser">carabiner</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:18:58 1754590738"><a href="item?id=44828349">59 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828349"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828277" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828560" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828023" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828349" n="4" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It's the "same amount of time" part that is blatantly wrong. Yes geometry has an effect but there is zero reason to believe leading edge particles, at the same time point, must rejoin at the trailing edge of a wing. This is a misconception at the level of "heavier objects fall faster." It is non-physical.<p>The video in the Cambridge link shows how the upper surface particles greatly <i>overtake</i> the lower surface flow. They do not rejoin, ever.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828349&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828349" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828456" href="vote?id=44828456&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=timr" class="hnuser">timr</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:26:55 1754591215"><a href="item?id=44828456">51 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828456"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828349" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828023" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828456" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c73">Again, you're not wrong, it's just irrelevant for most audiences. The very fact that you have to say this:<p>&gt; <i>Yes geometry has an effect</i> but there is zero reason to believe leading edge particles, at the same time point, must rejoin at the trailing edge of a wing.</p><p>...implicitly concedes that point that this is <i>subtle</i>. If you gave this answer in a PhD qualification exam in Physics, then sure, I think it's fair for someone to say you're wrong. If you gave the answer on a marketing page for a general-purpose chatbot? Meh.</p><p>(As an aside, this conversation is interesting to me primarily because it's a <i>perfect</i> example of how scientists go wrong in presenting their work to the world...meeting up with AI criticism on the other side.)</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828456&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828456" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828049" href="vote?id=44828049&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=Tadpole9181" class="hnuser">Tadpole9181</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:00:31 1754589631"><a href="item?id=44828049">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828049"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827735" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828269" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828230" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828049" n="4" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Sorry, I know nothing about this topic, but this is how it was explained to me every time it's come up throughout my life. Could you explain a bit more?<p>I've always been under the impression that flat-plate airfoils <i>can't</i> generate lift without a positive angle-of-attack - where lift is generated through the separate mechanism of the air pushing against an angled plane? But a modern airfoil can, because of this effect.</p><p>And that if you flip them upside down, a flat plate is more efficient and requires less angle-of-attack than the standard airfoil shape because now the lift advantage is working to generate a downforce.</p><p>I just tried to search Google, but I'm finding all sorts of conflicting answers, with only a vague consensus that the AI-provided answer above is, in fact, correct. The shape of the wing causes pressure differences that generate lift <i>in conjunction</i> with multiple other effects that also generate lift by pushing or redirecting air downward.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828049&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828049" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828477" href="vote?id=44828477&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=stonemetal12" class="hnuser">stonemetal12</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:28:08 1754591288"><a href="item?id=44828477">50 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828477"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828049" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828305" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828477" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">&gt;Air over the top has to travel farther in the same amount of time<p>There is no requirement for air to travel any where. <table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828607" href="vote?id=44828607&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=ricardobayes" class="hnuser">ricardobayes</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:37:24 1754591844"><a href="item?id=44828607">41 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828607"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827735" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827914" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828607" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">To me, it's weird to call it "PhD-level". That, to me, means to be able to take in existing information on a certain very niche area and able to "push the boundary". It also seems very confusing to me that many sources mention "stone age" and "PhD-level" in the same article. <table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828096" href="vote?id=44828096&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=Vegenoid" class="hnuser">Vegenoid</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:03:12 1754589792"><a href="item?id=44828096">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828096"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827715" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827940" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828096" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">&gt; No clue how they let it pass<p>It’s very common to see AI evangelists taking its output at face value, particularly when it’s about something that they are not an expert in. Their ability to sound correct continues to increase faster than their ability to <i>be</i> correct.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828096&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828096" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828290" href="vote?id=44828290&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=chasd00" class="hnuser">chasd00</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:14:48 1754590488"><a href="item?id=44828290">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828290"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828096" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827940" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828290" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">This is just like the early days of Google search results, "It's on the Internet, it must be true".</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828290&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828290" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827940" href="vote?id=44827940&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=traceroute66" class="hnuser">traceroute66</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:54:09 1754589249"><a href="item?id=44827940">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827940"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827715" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828096" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827885" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827940" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Hilarious how the team spent so much time promising GPT5 had fewer hallucinations and deceptions.<p>Meanwhile the demo seems to suggest business as usual for AI hallucinations and deceptions.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827940&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827940" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827885" href="vote?id=44827885&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=theappsecguy" class="hnuser">theappsecguy</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:51:07 1754589067"><a href="item?id=44827885">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827885"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827715" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827940" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828180" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827885" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">This is the headline for all LLM output past "hello world"</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827885&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827885" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828180" href="vote?id=44828180&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=stanmancan" class="hnuser">stanmancan</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:08:33 1754590113"><a href="item?id=44828180">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828180"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827715" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827885" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827888" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828180" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">&gt; Yeah, the explanation is just shallow enough to seem correct and deceive someone who doesn't grasp really well the subject.<p>This is the problem with AI in general.</p><p>When I ask it about things I already understand, it’s clearly wrong quite often.</p><p>When I ask it about something I don’t understand, I have no way to know if its response is right or wrong.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828180&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828180" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

The explanation is quite /probable/, as evidenced by the fact that they thought to use it as an example…</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827907&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827907" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828869" href="vote?id=44828869&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=ethan_smith" class="hnuser">ethan_smith</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:58:53 1754593133"><a href="item?id=44828869">19 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828869"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827498" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827907" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828122" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828869" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">You're right - this is the "equal transit time" fallacy; lift is primarily generated by the wing deflecting air downward (Newton's Third Law) and the pressure distribution resulting from airflow curvature around the wing.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828869&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828869" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
