I mean at this point Elon has 1000s of hours of practice doing interviews, pitches, presentations, conferences, etc. See Sam Altman in this context.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828192&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828192" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828394" href="vote?id=44828394&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=seydor" class="hnuser">seydor</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:22:00 1754590920"><a href="item?id=44828394">56 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828394"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827250" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827544" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828143" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828888" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828394" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">researchers should need to be tortured like this. But maybe if they are paid so much, they should</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828394&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828394" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828888" href="vote?id=44828888&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=pxc" class="hnuser">pxc</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:00:02 1754593202"><a href="item?id=44828888">18 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828888"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827250" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827544" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828394" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827650" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828888" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It seemed like good performances from people whose main skillset is not this.<p>For me, it's knowing what we know about the company and its history that gave a eerie feeling in combination with the sterility.</p><p>When they brought on the woman who has cancer, I felt deeply uncomfortable. My dad also has cancer right now. He's unlikely to survive. Watching a cancer patient come on to tell their story as part of an extended advertisement, expression serene, any hint of discomfort or pain or fear or bitterness completely hidden, ongoing hardship acknowledged only with a few shallow and euphemistic words, felt deeply uncomfortable to me.</p><p>Maybe this person enthusiastically volunteered, because she feels happy about what her husband is working on, and grateful for the ways that ChatGPT has helped her prepare for her appointments with doctors. I don't want to disrespect or discredit her, and I've also used LLMs alongside web searches in trying to formulare questions about my father's illness, so I understand how this is a real use case.</p><p>But something about it just felt wrong, inauthentic. I found myself wondering if she or her husband felt pressured to make this appearance. I also wondered if this kind of storytelling was irresponsible or deceptive, designed to describe technically responsible uses of LLMs (preparing notes for doctor's visits, where someone will verify the LLM's outputs against real expertise), but to suggest in every conceivable implicit way that these ChatGPT is actually capable of medical expertise itself. Put alongside "subject-matter experts in your pocket", talk of use in medical research and practice (where machine learning has a dubious history of deception and methodological misapplication problems), what are people likely to think?</p><p>I thought also of my mom, who drives herself crazy with anxiety every time my dad gets a new test result, obsessively trying to directly interpret them herself from the moment they arrive to his doctor's visit a week or two later. What impression would this clip leave on her? Does the idea of her using an LLM in this way feel safe to me?</p><p>There's a deeper sense that OpenAI's messaging, mission, and orientation are some mixture of deceptive and incoherent that leaves viewers with the sense that we're being lied to in presentations like this. It goes beyond stiff performances or rehearsed choices of words.</p><p>There's something cultish about the "AGI" hype, the sci-fi fever dream of "safety" problems that the field has mainstreamed, the slippage of OpenAI from a non-profit research institution to a for-profit startup all while claiming to be focused on the same mission, the role of AI as an oracle so opaque it might as well be magic, the idea of finding a sacred "rationality" in predictions founded purely on statistics without communicable/interrogable structural or causal models... all of it. It's against this backdrop that the same kind of stiffness that might be cute or campy in an infomercial for kitchen gadgets becomes uncanny.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828888&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828888" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827650" href="vote?id=44827650&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=mhh__" class="hnuser">mhh__</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:38:31 1754588311"><a href="item?id=44827650">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827650"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827250" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827544" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828888" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827961" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827650" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c5A">Well yes I think part of the reason it's slightly unnerving is that this actually how they act irl. Sometimes people need a bit of edge to 'em!</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827650&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827650" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

It's fine, it's not his mother tongue, and public speaking is hard. Why make him do it then?</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827961&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827961" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827387" href="vote?id=44827387&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=diggan" class="hnuser">diggan</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:22:01 1754587321"><a href="item?id=44827387">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827387"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827250" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827544" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827453" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827387" n="9" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Not even 10 seconds after I started watching the stream, someone said how much more human GPT-5 is, while the people sitting and talking about it don't seem human at all, and it's not an accent/language thing. Seems they're strictly following a dialogue script that is trying to make them seem "impromptu" but the acting isn't quite there for that :)</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827387&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827387" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827815" href="vote?id=44827815&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jazzyjackson" class="hnuser">jazzyjackson</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:47:11 1754588831"><a href="item?id=44827815">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827815"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827250" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827387" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827788" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827815" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I use LLMs to get answers to queries but I avoid having conversations with them because I'm aware we pick up idiosyncrasies and colloquialisms from everyone we interact with. People who spend all day talking to thier GPT-voice will adjust their speaking style to be more similar to the bot.<p>I developed this paranoia upon learning about <i>The Ape and the Child</i> where they raised a chimp alongside a baby boy and found the human adapted to chimp behavior faster than the chimp adapted to human behavior. I fear the same with bots, we'll become more like them faster than they'll become like us.</p><p><a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/25/538580495/what-are-the-planet-s-real-talking-chimps-and-gorillas-saying" rel="nofollow">https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/25/5385804...</a></p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827815&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827815" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827594" href="vote?id=44827594&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=HaZeust" class="hnuser">HaZeust</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:34:17 1754588057"><a href="item?id=44827594">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827594"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827250" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827387" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827788" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827558" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827594" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">One woman who went through her calendar with GPT had good acting that the GPT reply helped her find impromptu information (an email she needed to answer), and someone staged GPT-5 to make a French-learning website lander - which butchered its own design in the second run; but that's all the good acting for a "candid presentation" that I could find.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827594&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827594" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827938" href="vote?id=44827938&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=HaZeust" class="hnuser">HaZeust</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:53:58 1754589238"><a href="item?id=44827938">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827938"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827250" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827726" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827558" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827938" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I laughed my ass off immediately after it gave that output, until the presenter made clear that it was a flash card for learning the words, "the cat" in French - and backed it up.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827938&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827938" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827558" href="vote?id=44827558&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=MattSayar" class="hnuser">MattSayar</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:31:33 1754587893"><a href="item?id=44827558">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827558"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827250" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827387" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827594" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827526" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827558" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Presenting is hard</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827558&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827558" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827657" href="vote?id=44827657&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=AnimalMuppet" class="hnuser">AnimalMuppet</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:39:18 1754588358"><a href="item?id=44827657">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827657"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827250" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827558" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827526" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827657" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Presenting where you have to be exactly on the content with no deviation is hard. To do that without sounding like a robot is <i>very</i> hard.<p>Presenting isn't that hard if you know your content thoroughly, and care about it. You just get up and talk about something that you care about, within a somewhat-structured outline.</p><p>Presenting where customers and the financial press are watching and parsing every word, and any slip of the tongue can have real consequences? Yeah, um... find somebody else.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827657&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827657" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827123" href="vote?id=44827123&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=cuuupid" class="hnuser">cuuupid</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:07:33 1754586453"><a href="item?id=44827123">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827123"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827250" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827167" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827123" n="6" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">The silent victory here is this seems like it is being built to be faster and cheaper than o3 while presenting a reasonable jump, which is an important jump in scaling law<p>On the other hand if it's just getting bigger and slower it's not a good sign for LLMs</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827123&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827123" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827776" href="vote?id=44827776&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=smlacy" class="hnuser">smlacy</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:45:11 1754588711"><a href="item?id=44827776">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827776"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827123" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827185" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827776" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Yeah, this very much feels like "we have made a more efficient/scalable model and we're selling it as the new shiny but it's really just an internal optimization to reduce cost"</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827776&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827776" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828674" href="vote?id=44828674&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=reasonableklout" class="hnuser">reasonableklout</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:41:43 1754592103"><a href="item?id=44828674">37 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828674"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827123" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827776" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827185" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828674" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Significant cost reduction while providing the same performance seems pretty big to me?<p>Not sure why a more efficient/scalable model isn't exciting</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828674&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828674" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829106" href="vote?id=44829106&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=joshstrange" class="hnuser">joshstrange</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:17:45 1754594265"><a href="item?id=44829106">0 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829106"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827167" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828588" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827252" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829106" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">OpenAI does this for literally _every_ release. As a paying Plus member it irks me to no end, they almost never hit their self-imposed deadlines.<p>The linked page says</p><p>&gt; GPT-5 is here &gt; Our smartest, fastest, and most useful model yet, with thinking built in. <table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827379" href="vote?id=44827379&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=Kurtz79" class="hnuser">Kurtz79</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:21:24 1754587284"><a href="item?id=44827379">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827379"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827167" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827273" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827388" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827379" n="5" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c5A">"what model are you?"<p>ChatGPT said: You're chatting with ChatGPT based on the GPT-4o architecture (also known as GPT-4 omni), released by OpenAI in May 2024.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827379&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827379" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827488" href="vote?id=44827488&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=pjerem" class="hnuser">pjerem</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:27:51 1754587671"><a href="item?id=44827488">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827488"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827167" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827379" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827488" n="4" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Actually this trick have been proven to be useless in a lot of cases.<p>LLMs don’t inherently know what they are because "they" are not themselves part of the training data.</p><p>However, maybe it’s working because the information is somewhere into their pre-prompt but if it wasn’t, it wouldn’t say « I don’t know » but rather hallucinate something.</p><p>So maybe that’s true but you cannot be sure.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827488&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827488" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828235" href="vote?id=44828235&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=dpoloncsak" class="hnuser">dpoloncsak</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:11:50 1754590310"><a href="item?id=44828235">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828235"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827167" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827488" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827868" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828235" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">If you believe 'leaked system prompts', it tends to be part of the system prompt.<p>I believe most of these came from asking the LLMs, and I don't know if they've been proven to not be a hallucination.</p><p><a href="https://github.com/jujumilk3/leaked-system-prompts" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/jujumilk3/leaked-system-prompts</a></p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828235&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828235" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827868" href="vote?id=44827868&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=efilife" class="hnuser">efilife</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:50:18 1754589018"><a href="item?id=44827868">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827868"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827167" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827488" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828235" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827868" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It's injected into their system prompt</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827868&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827868" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="5"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="200"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828247" href="vote?id=44828247&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=seba_dos1" class="hnuser">seba_dos1</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:12:42 1754590362"><a href="item?id=44828247">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828247"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827167" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827868" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828247" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">...which is useless when the model gets changed in-between responses.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828247&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828247" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827314" href="vote?id=44827314&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=davepeck" class="hnuser">davepeck</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:17:52 1754587072"><a href="item?id=44827314">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827314"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827167" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828865" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827314" n="9" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Sam Altman, in the summer update video:<p>&gt; "[GPT-5] can write an entire computer program from scratch, to help you with whatever you'd like. And we think this idea of software on demand is going to be one of the defining characteristics of the GPT-5 era."</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827314&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827314" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827394" href="vote?id=44827394&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=data-ottawa" class="hnuser">data-ottawa</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:22:21 1754587341"><a href="item?id=44827394">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827394"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827365" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827394" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Nit: the featured jumping game is trivial to beat by just continuously jumping.<p>I’m not sure this will be game changing vs existing offerings</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827394&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827394" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827365" href="vote?id=44827365&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=mlnj" class="hnuser">mlnj</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:20:14 1754587214"><a href="item?id=44827365">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827365"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827394" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827427" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827365" n="4" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Cannot believe how it could stand up to that high expectation.<p>But then again, all of this is a hype machine cranked up till the next one needs cranking.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827365&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827365" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827471" href="vote?id=44827471&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jononor" class="hnuser">jononor</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:27:02 1754587622"><a href="item?id=44827471">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827471"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827365" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827509" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827471" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">There are so many people on-board with this idea, hypemen collaborators, that I think they might be safe for a year or two more. The hypers will shout about how miraculous it is, and tell everyone that does not get the promised value that "you are just holding it wrong". This buys them a fair amount of time to improve things.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827471&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827471" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827509" href="vote?id=44827509&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=davepeck" class="hnuser">davepeck</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:28:42 1754587722"><a href="item?id=44827509">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827509"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827365" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827471" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827427" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827509" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Yeah.<p>It does feel like we're marching toward a day when "software on tap" is a practical or even mundane fact of life.</p><p>But, despite the utility of today's frontier models, it also feels to me like we're <i>very</i> far from that day. Put another way: my first computer was a C64; I don't expect I'll be alive to see the day.</p><p>Then again, maybe GPT-5 will make me a believer. My attitude toward AI marketing is that it's 100% hype until proven otherwise -- for instance, proven to be only 87% hype. :-)</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827509&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827509" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829073" href="vote?id=44829073&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=coffeebeqn" class="hnuser">coffeebeqn</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:15:35 1754594135"><a href="item?id=44829073">3 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829073"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827509" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827427" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829073" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Just like self driving. <table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827427" href="vote?id=44827427&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=moralestapia" class="hnuser">moralestapia</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:24:25 1754587465"><a href="item?id=44827427">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827427"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827365" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827842" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827427" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">He said something like "entering the fast fashion era of SaaS" recently.<p>GPT-5 doesn't seem to get you there tho ...</p><p>(Disclaimer: But I am 100% sure it will happen eventually)</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827427&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827427" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827842" href="vote?id=44827842&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jazzyjackson" class="hnuser">jazzyjackson</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:48:50 1754588930"><a href="item?id=44827842">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827842"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827427" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828865" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827842" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">"an entire computer program from scratch" != "any entire computer program from scratch"</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827842&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827842" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828865" href="vote?id=44828865&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=lifty" class="hnuser">lifty</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:58:40 1754593120"><a href="item?id=44828865">20 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828865"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827314" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827563" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828865" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It seems to me that there’s no way to achieve AGI with the current LLM approach. <table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827871" href="vote?id=44827871&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=demirbey05" class="hnuser">demirbey05</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:50:31 1754589031"><a href="item?id=44827871">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827871"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827637" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827947" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827871" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">IMO is not breakthrough, if you craft proper prompts you can excel imo with 2.5 Pro. Paper : <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2507.15855" rel="nofollow">https://arxiv.org/abs/2507.15855</a>. Google just put whole computational power with very high quality data. It was test-time scaling. Why it didn't solve problem 6 as well?<p>Yes, it was breakthrough but saturated quickly. Wait for next breakthrough. If they can build adapting weights in llm we can talk different things but test time scaling coming to end with increasing hallucination rate. No sign for AGI.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827871&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827871" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828356" href="vote?id=44828356&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=impossiblefork" class="hnuser">impossiblefork</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:19:30 1754590770"><a href="item?id=44828356">59 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828356"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827871" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827947" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828356" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It wasn't long ago that test-time scaling wasn't possible. Test-time scaling is a core part of what makes this a breakthrough.<p>I don't believe your assessment though. IMO is hard, and Google have said that they use search and some way of combining different reasoning traces, so while I haven't read that paper yet, and of course, it may support your view, but I just don't believe it.</p><p>We are not close to solving IMO with publicly known methods.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828356&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828356" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828584" href="vote?id=44828584&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=demirbey05" class="hnuser">demirbey05</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:35:13 1754591713"><a href="item?id=44828584">43 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828584"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828356" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827947" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828584" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">test time scaling is based on methods from pre-2020. If you look details of modern LLMs its pretty small prob to encounter method from 2020+(ROPE,GRPO). I am not saying IMO is not impressive, but it is not breakthrough, if they said they used different paradigm then test-time scaling I would say breakthrough.<p>&gt; We are not close to solving IMO with publicly known methods. The point here is not method rather computation power. You can solve any verifiable task with high computation, absolutely there must be tweaks in methods but I don't think it is something very big and different. Just OAI asserted they solved with breakthrough.</p><p>Wait for self-adapting LLMs. We will see at most in 2 years, now all big tech are focusing on that I think.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828584&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828584" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827947" href="vote?id=44827947&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=pton_xd" class="hnuser">pton_xd</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:54:41 1754589281"><a href="item?id=44827947">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827947"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827637" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827871" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827807" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827947" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Layman's perspective: we had hints of reasoning from the initial release of ChatGPT when people figured out you could prompt "think step by step" to drastically increase problem solving performance. Then yeah a year+ later it was cleverly incorporated into model training.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827947&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827947" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828338" href="vote?id=44828338&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=impossiblefork" class="hnuser">impossiblefork</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:18:03 1754590683"><a href="item?id=44828338">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828338"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827947" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827807" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828338" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Fine, but to me reasoning is this the where you have &lt;think&gt; tags and use RL to decide what's to be generated in-between them.<p>Of course, people regarded things like GSM8k with trained reasoning traces as reasoning too, but it's pretty obviously not quite the same thing.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828338&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828338" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

What they mean is the exponential expectations are done.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828165&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828165" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827911" href="vote?id=44827911&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=demirbey05" class="hnuser">demirbey05</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:52:40 1754589160"><a href="item?id=44827911">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827911"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827807" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828165" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827443" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827911" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I don't remember as a big fan of DeepSeek.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827911&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827911" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829026" href="vote?id=44829026&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=nonhaver" class="hnuser">nonhaver</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:10:40 1754593840"><a href="item?id=44829026">8 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829026"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827911" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827443" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829026" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">you dont remember deepseek introducing reasoning and blowing benchmarks led by private american companies out of the water? with an api that was way cheaper? and then offered the model free in a chat based system online? and you were a big fan?</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44829026&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344829026" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827443" href="vote?id=44827443&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=nonhaver" class="hnuser">nonhaver</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:25:37 1754587537"><a href="item?id=44827443">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827443"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827807" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827195" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827443" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">i think this is more an effect of releasing a model every other month with gradual improvements. if there was no o-series/other thinking models on the market - people would be shocked by this upgrade. the only way to keep up with the market is to release improvements asap</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827443&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827443" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827682" href="vote?id=44827682&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=ModernMech" class="hnuser">ModernMech</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:40:33 1754588433"><a href="item?id=44827682">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827682"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827443" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827195" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827682" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I don't agree, the only thing thing that would shock me about this model is if it didn't hallucinate.<p>I think the actual effect of releasing more models every month has been to confuse people that progress is actually happening. Despite claims of exponentially improved performance and the ability to replace PhDs, doctors, and lawyers, it still routinely can't be trusted the same as the original ChatGPT, despite years of effort.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827682&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827682" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828999" href="vote?id=44828999&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=nonhaver" class="hnuser">nonhaver</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:08:13 1754593693"><a href="item?id=44828999">10 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828999"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827682" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827195" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828999" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">this is a very odd perspective. as someone who uses LLMs for coding/PRs - every time a new model released my personal experience was that it was a very solid improvement on the previous generation and not just meant to "confuse". the jump from raw GPT-4 2 years ago to o3 full is so unbelievable if you traveled back in time and showed me i wouldn't have thought such technology would exist for 5+ years.<p>to the point on hallucination - that's just the nature of LLMs (and humans to some extent). without new architectures or fact checking world models in place i don't think that problem will be solved anytime soon. but it seems gpt-5 main selling point is they somehow reduced the hallucination rate by a lot + search helps with grounding.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828999&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828999" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827195" href="vote?id=44827195&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=amelius" class="hnuser">amelius</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:11:03 1754586663"><a href="item?id=44827195">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827195"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827443" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827142" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827195" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Is there a graph somewhere that illustrates it?</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827195&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827195" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827557" href="vote?id=44827557&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=onlyrealcuzzo" class="hnuser">onlyrealcuzzo</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:31:32 1754587892"><a href="item?id=44827557">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827557"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827195" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827142" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827557" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00"><a href="https://epoch.ai/data-insights/llm-apis-accuracy-runtime-tradeoff" rel="nofollow">https://epoch.ai/data-insights/llm-apis-accuracy-runtime-tra...</a><p>It is easier to get from 0% accurate to 99% accurate, than it is to get from 99% accurate to 99.9% accurate.</p><p>This is like the classic 9s problem in SRE. Each nine is exponentially more difficult.</p><p>How easy do we really think it will be for an LLM to get 100% accurate at physics, when we don't even know what 100% right is, and it's theoretically possible it's not even physically possible?</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827557&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827557" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827142" href="vote?id=44827142&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=dismalaf" class="hnuser">dismalaf</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:08:32 1754586512"><a href="item?id=44827142">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827142"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827119" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827195" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828583" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827142" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It's seemed that way for the last year. The only real improvements have been in the chat apps themselves (internet access, function calling). Until AI gets past the pre-training problem, it'll stagnate.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827142&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827142" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827204" href="vote?id=44827204&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=croemer" class="hnuser">croemer</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:11:41 1754586701"><a href="item?id=44827204">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827204"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828968" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827291" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827204" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">The presentation asks for a moving svg to illustrate Bernoulli, that's suspiciously close to a Pelican.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827204&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827204" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827291" href="vote?id=44827291&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=bogtog" class="hnuser">bogtog</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:16:40 1754587000"><a href="item?id=44827291">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827291"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827204" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827722" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827291" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">&gt; With GPT-5 we will be deprecating all of our prior models<p>Wow, they actually did it</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827291&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827291" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827783" href="vote?id=44827783&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=smlacy" class="hnuser">smlacy</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:45:44 1754588744"><a href="item?id=44827783">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827783"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827291" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827722" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827783" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">GPT-5 is likely much cheaper to serve, and that's the "big win" here, not necessarily any improvement in output.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827783&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827783" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827722" href="vote?id=44827722&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=marliechiller" class="hnuser">marliechiller</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:42:08 1754588528"><a href="item?id=44827722">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827722"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827291" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827722" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I could well be missing something obvious but it seems like the jump between 4 &amp; 5 is much less than many will be anticipating</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827722&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827722" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827060" href="vote?id=44827060&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=bmau5" class="hnuser">bmau5</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:04:19 1754586259"><a href="item?id=44827060">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827060"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827722" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827178" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827060" n="20" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It's very interesting how memetic the language around different models is. Elon seems to have coined "PhD level intelligence in all topics" and now Sam repeated it in his presentation. Despite it not having an actual meaning. I think OpenAI will coin they've achieved AGI first (as they have incentives to based on the rumored contract with MSFT), and then everyone will claim we've achieved it.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827060&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827060" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827822" href="vote?id=44827822&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=Telemakhos" class="hnuser">Telemakhos</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:47:51 1754588871"><a href="item?id=44827822">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827822"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827203" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827822" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">As a fairly dumb person with a PhD, I can attest that a degree means perseverance, not intelligence.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827822&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827822" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828026" href="vote?id=44828026&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=ToValueFunfetti" class="hnuser">ToValueFunfetti</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:59:33 1754589573"><a href="item?id=44828026">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828026"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827822" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827203" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828026" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">After watching Claude cheerfully circle Team Rocket HQ for a month, I can attest that perseverence is not what stands between current models and PhDs.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828026&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828026" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827203" href="vote?id=44827203&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=clueless" class="hnuser">clueless</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:11:35 1754586695"><a href="item?id=44827203">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827203"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827822" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828413" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827203" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Elon did not coin this, Kurzweil has been using this coinage for a lot longer.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827203&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827203" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828413" href="vote?id=44828413&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=seydor" class="hnuser">seydor</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:23:45 1754591025"><a href="item?id=44828413">54 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828413"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827203" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827089" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828413" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I gotta say PhDs are a dime a dozen these days, and yet we are talking about science stagnation.<p>And PhDs are not very smart imho (I am one)</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828413&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828413" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828546" href="vote?id=44828546&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=bmau5" class="hnuser">bmau5</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:33:18 1754591598"><a href="item?id=44828546">45 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828546"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828413" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827089" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828546" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">As a non-PhD, most PhD's insist most PhD's aren't smart - and yet I find them to generally be the smartest people I know :)</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828546&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828546" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827089" href="vote?id=44827089&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=riku_iki" class="hnuser">riku_iki</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:06:05 1754586365"><a href="item?id=44827089">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827089"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828413" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827178" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827089" n="13" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">OpenAI has clear and strange definition of AGI in contract with MSFT: it should produce 100B economic impact.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827089&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827089" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827264" href="vote?id=44827264&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=wavemode" class="hnuser">wavemode</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:15:19 1754586919"><a href="item?id=44827264">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827264"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827089" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828182" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827264" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Does it count if the impact is negative?</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827264&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827264" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828182" href="vote?id=44828182&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=og_kalu" class="hnuser">og_kalu</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:08:45 1754590125"><a href="item?id=44828182">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828182"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827089" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827264" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827121" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828182" n="9" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">That not their definition of AGI. It's "a highly autonomous system that can outperform humans at most economically valuable work."</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828182&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828182" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828332" href="vote?id=44828332&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=9rx" class="hnuser">9rx</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:17:40 1754590660"><a href="item?id=44828332">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828332"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828182" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827121" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828332" n="8" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Your half of the definition is implied, but uninteresting. They would not see the 100B economic impact without your definition being realized. But what is curious about it is that it is <i>also</i> not to be considered AGI without meeting the value marker. "a highly autonomous system that can outperform humans at most economically valuable work." alone is not sufficient.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828332&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828332" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
