Money generated by direct usage <i>is</i> economic impact by the model.<p>If you use GPT-N substantially in your work, then saying that impact rests solely on you is nonsensical.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828679&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828679" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="7"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="280"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828794" href="vote?id=44828794&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=9rx" class="hnuser">9rx</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:52:08 1754592728"><a href="item?id=44828794">26 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828794"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828679" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827121" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828794" n="4" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00"><i>&gt; Money generated by direct usage is economic impact by the model.</i><p>But not at the "hand" of AGI. Perhaps you forgot to read your very own definition? Notably the "autonomous" part.</p><p>When AGI is set free and starts up "Closed I", generating $12B in economic value without humans steering the wheel, we will be (well, I will be, at least!) throughly impressed. But Microsoft won't be. They won't consider it AGI until it does $100B.</p><p>&gt; If you use GPT-N substantially in your work, then saying that impact rests solely on you is nonsensical.</p><p>And if you use a hammer substantially in your work to generate $100B in value, a hammer is AGI according to you? <table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="8"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="320"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828951" href="vote?id=44828951&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=og_kalu" class="hnuser">og_kalu</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:04:35 1754593475"><a href="item?id=44828951">14 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828951"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828794" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827121" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828951" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Maybe you missed the part where I explicitly said that wasn't their definition ?<p>“A highly autonomous system that outperforms humans at most economically valuable work.” is what's in their charter.</p><p>$100B in profits is a separate agreement with Microsoft that makes no mention of autonomity.</p><p>&gt;And if you use a hammer substantially in your work to generate $100B in value, a hammer is AGI according to you? You can hold that idea, but that's not what anyone else is talking about. The primary indicator of AGI, as you even said yourself, is autonomy.</p><p>The primary indicator of AGI is whatever you want it to be. The words themselves make no promises of autonomity, simply an intelligence general in nature. We are simply discussing Open AI's definitions.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="9"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="360"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829002" href="vote?id=44829002&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=9rx" class="hnuser">9rx</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:08:34 1754593714"><a href="item?id=44829002">10 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829002"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828951" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827121" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829002" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">&gt; $100B in profits is a separate agreement with Microsoft that makes no mention of autonomity.<p>Again, autonomy is implied when talking about AGI. OpenAI selling tools like GPT or dishwashers, even if they were to provide the $100B in economic impact, would not satisfy the agreement. It is specifically about AGI, and there should be no confusion about what AGI is here as you helpfully defined it for us.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="10"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="400"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44829102" href="vote?id=44829102&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=og_kalu" class="hnuser">og_kalu</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T19:17:30 1754594250"><a href="item?id=44829102">1 minute ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44829102"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827060" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44829002" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827121" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44829102" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">AGI - Artificial General Intelligence<p>Where in that acronym is human level autonomy implied ?</p><p>Norvig would tell you we already have AGI.</p><p><a href="https://www.noemamag.com/artificial-general-intelligence-is-already-here/" rel="nofollow">https://www.noemamag.com/artificial-general-intelligence-is-...</a></p><p>If Open AI didn't mention autonomy in their Microsoft agreement then it's not part of the equation and no court will take, "It was obvious" as an argument.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828375" href="vote?id=44828375&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=dsign" class="hnuser">dsign</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:20:51 1754590851"><a href="item?id=44828375">57 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828375"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827286" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827595" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827865" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828375" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Even if AI could help, it won’t in the current system. The current system which is throwing trillions into AI research on the incentive to replace expensive labor, all while people don’t have basic health insurance.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828375&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828375" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827865" href="vote?id=44827865&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=captainclam" class="hnuser">captainclam</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:50:09 1754589009"><a href="item?id=44827865">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827865"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827286" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828375" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828098" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827865" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It's very easy to imagine a world where all these things are solved, but it is a worse world to live in overall.<p>I don't think it is "bad" to be sincerely worried that the current trajectory of AI progress represents this trade.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827865&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827865" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828098" href="vote?id=44828098&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jrboyens" class="hnuser">jrboyens</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:03:22 1754589802"><a href="item?id=44828098">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828098"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827286" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827865" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827746" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828098" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I mean, that presumes that the answer to generating your anti-cancer pill, or the universal cure to heart disease has already been found, but humans can't see it because the data is disparate.<p>The likelihood of all that is incredibly slim. It's not 0% -- nothing ever really is -- but it is effectively so.</p><p>Especially with the economics of scientific research, the reproducibility crisis, and general anti-science meme spreading throughout the populace. The data, the information, isn't there. Even if it was, it'd be like Alzheimer's research: down the wrong road because of faked science.</p><p>There is no one coming to save humanity. There is only our hard work.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828098&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828098" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828296" href="vote?id=44828296&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=apwell23" class="hnuser">apwell23</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:15:24 1754590524"><a href="item?id=44828296">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828296"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827286" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827751" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827251" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828296" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c5A">cancer is just aging . we all have to die somehow when its time to go.<p>How exactly do you wish death comes to you?</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828296&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828296" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827251" href="vote?id=44827251&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=hirvi74" class="hnuser">hirvi74</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:14:26 1754586866"><a href="item?id=44827251">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827251"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827171" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827286" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827183" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827251" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I am not sure that we are not presented with a Catch-22. Yes, life might likely be better for developers and other careers if AI fails to live up to expectations. However, a lot companies, i.e., many of our employers, have invested a lot of money in these products. In the event AI fails, I think the stretched rubber band of economics will slap back <i>hard.</i> So, many might end up losing their jobs (and more) anyway.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827251&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827251" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827307" href="vote?id=44827307&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=nemomarx" class="hnuser">nemomarx</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:17:32 1754587052"><a href="item?id=44827307">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827307"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827251" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827634" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827307" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Even if it takes off, they might have invested in the wrong picks or etc. If you think of the dot com boom the Internet was eventually a very successful thing, e commerce did work out, but there were a lot of losing horses to bet on.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827307&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827307" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827634" href="vote?id=44827634&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=RivieraKid" class="hnuser">RivieraKid</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:37:03 1754588223"><a href="item?id=44827634">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827634"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827251" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827307" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827183" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827634" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">If AI fails to continue to improve, the worst-case economic outcome is a short and mild recession and probably not even that.<p>Once sector of the economy would cut down on investment spending, which can be easily offset by decreasing the interest rate.</p><p>But this is a short-term effect. What I'm worried is a structural change of the labor market, which would be positive for most people, but probably negative for people like me.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827634&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827634" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827183" href="vote?id=44827183&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=amarcheschi" class="hnuser">amarcheschi</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:10:31 1754586631"><a href="item?id=44827183">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827183"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827171" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827213" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827183" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Seeing the system card <a href="https://cdn.openai.com/pdf/8124a3ce-ab78-4f06-96eb-49ea29ffb52f/gpt5-system-card-aug7.pdf" rel="nofollow">https://cdn.openai.com/pdf/8124a3ce-ab78-4f06-96eb-49ea29ffb...</a><p>there is some improvements in some benchs and not else worthy of note in coding. i only took a peek though so i might be wrong</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827183&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827183" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827315" href="vote?id=44827315&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=9rx" class="hnuser">9rx</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:17:53 1754587073"><a href="item?id=44827315">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827315"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827213" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827532" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827315" n="5" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">You are losing your job either way. Either AI will successfully take it, or as you no doubt read in the article yesterday, AI is the only thing propping up the economy, so the jobs will also be cut in the fallout if AI fails to deliver.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827315&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827315" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827420" href="vote?id=44827420&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=thewebguyd" class="hnuser">thewebguyd</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:23:59 1754587439"><a href="item?id=44827420">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827420"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827315" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827532" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827420" n="4" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Except one is recoverable from, just as we eventually recovered from dotcom. The other is permanent and requires either government intervention in the form of UBI(good luck with that), or a significant amount of the population retraining for other careers and starting over, if that's even possible.<p>But yeah, you are correct in that no matter what, we're going to be left holding the bag.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827420&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827420" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827875" href="vote?id=44827875&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=RivieraKid" class="hnuser">RivieraKid</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:50:36 1754589036"><a href="item?id=44827875">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827875"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827420" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827666" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827875" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Exactly. A slowdown in AI investment spending would have a short-term and tiny effect on the economy.<p>I'm not worried about the scenario in which AI replaces all jobs, that's impossible any time soon and it would probably be a good thing for the vast majority of people.</p><p>What I'm worried about is a scenario in which some people, possibly me, will have to switch from a highly-paid, highly comfortable and above-average-status jobs to jobs that are below avarage in wage, comfort and status.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827875&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827875" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="4"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="160"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827666" href="vote?id=44827666&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=9rx" class="hnuser">9rx</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:40:04 1754588404"><a href="item?id=44827666">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827666"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827420" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827875" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827532" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827666" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00"><i>&gt; Except one is recoverable from, just as we eventually recovered from dotcom.</i><p>"Dotcom" was never recovered. It, however, did pave the way for web browsers to gain rich APIs that allowed us to deliver what was historically installed desktop software on an on-demand delivery platform, which created new work. As that was starting to die out, the so-called smartphone just so happened to come along. That offered us the opportunity to do it all over again, except this time we were taking those on-demand applications and turning them back into installable software just like in the desktop era. And as that was starting to die out COVID hit and we started moving those installable mobile apps, which became less important when people we no longer on the go all the time, back to the web again. As that was starting to die out, then came ChatGPT and it offered work porting all those applications to AI platforms.</p><p>But if AI fails to deliver, there isn't an obvious next venue for us to rebuild the same programs all over yet again. Meta thought maybe VR was it, but we know how that turned out. More likely in that scenario we will continue using the web/mobile/AI apps that are already written henceforth. We don't really need the same applications running in other places anymore.</p><p>There is still room for niche applications here and there. The profession isn't apt to die a complete death. But without the massive effort to continually port everything from one platform to another, you don't need that many people.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827666&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827666" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="5"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="200"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827986" href="vote?id=44827986&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=RivieraKid" class="hnuser">RivieraKid</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:56:57 1754589417"><a href="item?id=44827986">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827986"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827133" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827666" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827532" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827986" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">The idea that AI is somehow responsible for a huge chunk of software development demand is ridiculous. <table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828322" href="vote?id=44828322&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jumploops" class="hnuser">jumploops</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:17:01 1754590621"><a href="item?id=44828322">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828322"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44829081" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827523" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828322" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Is GPT-5 using a new pretrained base, or is it the same as GPT-4.1?<p>Given the low cost of GPT-5, compared to the prices we saw with GPT-4.5, my hunch is that this new model is actually just a bunch of RL on top of their existing models + automatic switching between reasoning/non-reasoning.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828322&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828322" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827523" href="vote?id=44827523&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=primaprashant" class="hnuser">primaprashant</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:29:33 1754587773"><a href="item?id=44827523">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827523"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828322" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44826932" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827523" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">GPT-5 was supposed to make choosing models and reasoning efforts simpler. I think they made it more complex.<p>&gt; GPT‑5’s reasoning_effort parameter can now take a minimal value to get answers back faster, without extensive reasoning first.</p><p>&gt; While GPT‑5 in ChatGPT is a system of reasoning, non-reasoning, and router models, GPT‑5 in the API platform is the reasoning model that powers maximum performance in ChatGPT. Notably, GPT‑5 with minimal reasoning is a different model than the non-reasoning model in ChatGPT, and is better tuned for developers. The non-reasoning model used in ChatGPT is available as gpt-5-chat-latest.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827523&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827523" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828127" href="vote?id=44828127&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=VeejayRampay" class="hnuser">VeejayRampay</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:04:48 1754589888"><a href="item?id=44828127">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828127"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827523" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44826932" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828127" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">reasoning effort is Gemini's thinking budget from 6 months ago</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828127&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828127" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44826932" href="vote?id=44826932&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=aliljet" class="hnuser">aliljet</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T16:54:14 1754585654"><a href="item?id=44826932">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44826932"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827523" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44829059" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44826932" n="8" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It's very unclear if OpenAI has been casually leaking things to create buzz, but a few days ago there was a pretty stunning pelican on a bike attempt: <a href="https://old.reddit.com/r/OpenAI/comments/1mettre/gpt5_is_already_ostensibly_available_via_api/n6cekdr/" rel="nofollow">https://old.reddit.com/r/OpenAI/comments/1mettre/gpt5_is_alr...</a><p>In practice, it's very clear to me that the most important value in writing software with an LLM isn't it's ability to one-shot hard problems, but rather it's ability to effectively manage complex context. There are no good evals for this kind of problem, but that's what I'm keenly interested in understanding. Show me GPT-5 can move through 10 steps in a list of tasks without completely losing the objective by the end.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44826932&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344826932" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44826962" href="vote?id=44826962&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=stri8ed" class="hnuser">stri8ed</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T16:57:05 1754585825"><a href="item?id=44826962">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44826962"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44826932" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44829059" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44826962" n="7" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">That problem along with its many solutions are surely littered throughout the training data. Not to mention, it would be trivial to overfit on that problem. I don't know why people still reference that.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44826962&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344826962" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827042" href="vote?id=44827042&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=ben_w" class="hnuser">ben_w</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:02:57 1754586177"><a href="item?id=44827042">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827042"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44826932" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44826962" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827259" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827042" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">&gt; That problem along with its many solutions are surely littered throughout the training data. Not to mention, it would be trivial to overfit on that problem.<p>It would be trivial to over-fit, if that was their goal.</p><p>But why would there be a large number of <i>good</i> SVG images of pelicans on bikes? Especially relative to all the things we actually want them to generalise over?</p><p>Surely most of the SVG images of pelicans on bikes are, right now, going to be "look at this rubbish AI output"? (Which may or may not be followed by a comment linking to that artist who got humans to draw bikes and oh boy were those humans wildly bad at drawing bikes, so an AI learning to draw SVGs from those bitmap pictures would likely also still suck…)</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827042&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827042" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827369" href="vote?id=44827369&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=arcumaereum" class="hnuser">arcumaereum</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:20:40 1754587240"><a href="item?id=44827369">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827369"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827397" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827489" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827369" n="4" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">In terms of raw prose quality, I'm not convinced GPT-5 sounds "less like AI" or "more like a friend". Just count the number of em-dashes. It's become something of a LLM shibboleth.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827369&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827369" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827802" href="vote?id=44827802&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=BoorishBears" class="hnuser">BoorishBears</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:46:40 1754588800"><a href="item?id=44827802">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827802"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827369" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827489" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827802" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I've worked on this problem for a year and I don't think you get meaningfully better at this without making it as much of a focus as frontier labs make coding.<p>They're all working on subjective improvements, but for example, none of them would develop and deploy a sampler that makes models 50% worse at coding but 50% less likely to use purple prose.</p><p>(And unlike the early days where better coding meant better everything, more of the gains are coming from very specific post-training that transfers less, and even harms performance there)</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827802&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827802" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827924" href="vote?id=44827924&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=arcumaereum" class="hnuser">arcumaereum</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:53:12 1754589192"><a href="item?id=44827924">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827924"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827369" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827802" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827489" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827924" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Interesting, is the implication that the sampler makes a big effect on both prose style and coding abilities? Hadn't really thought about that, I wonder if eg. selecting different samplers for different use cases could be a viable feature?</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827924&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827924" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828145" href="vote?id=44828145&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=BoorishBears" class="hnuser">BoorishBears</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:05:54 1754589954"><a href="item?id=44828145">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828145"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827369" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827924" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827489" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828145" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">There's so many layers to it but the short version is yes.<p>For example: You could ban em dash tokens entirely, but there are places like dialogue where you want them. You can write a sampler that only allows em dashes between quotation marks.</p><p>That's a highly contrived example because em dashes are useful in other places, but samplers in general can be as complex as your performance goals will allow (they are on the hot path for token generation)</p><p>Swapping samplers could be a thing, but you need more than that in the end. Even the idea of the model accepting loosely worded prompts for writing is a bit shakey: I see a lot of gains by breaking down the writing task into very specifc well-defined parts during post-training.</p><p>It's ok to let an LLM go from loose prompts to that format for UX, but during training you'll do a lot better than trying to learn on every way someone can ask for a piece of writing</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828145&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828145" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827489" href="vote?id=44827489&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=machiaweliczny" class="hnuser">machiaweliczny</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:27:53 1754587673"><a href="item?id=44827489">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827489"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827369" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827157" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827489" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Seems like it's just repackaging and UX, not really intelligence updgrade. They know that distribution wins so they want to be most approachable. Maybe multimodal improvements are there.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827489&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827489" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

Maybe the improvements are not to call home about?</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827157&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827157" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828130" href="vote?id=44828130&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=firefoxd" class="hnuser">firefoxd</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:04:57 1754589897"><a href="item?id=44828130">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828130"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827157" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827724" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828130" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Nay, laddie, that's no' the real AGI Scotsman. He's grander still! Wait til GPT-6 come out, you'll be blown away!<p><a href="https://idiallo.com/byte-size/ai-scotsman" rel="nofollow">https://idiallo.com/byte-size/ai-scotsman</a></p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828130&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828130" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827724" href="vote?id=44827724&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=koeng" class="hnuser">koeng</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:42:17 1754588537"><a href="item?id=44827724">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827724"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828130" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827318" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827724" n="9" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I hate the direction that American AI is going, and the model card of OpenAI is especially bad.<p>I am a synthetic biologist, and I use AI a lot for my work. And it constantly denies my questions RIGHT NOW. But of course OpenAI and Anthropic have to implement more - from the GPT5 introduction: "robust safety stack with a multilayered defense system for biology"</p><p>While that sounds nice and all, in practical terms, they already ban many of my questions. This just means they're going to lobotomize the model more and more for my field because of the so-called "experts". I am an expert. I can easily go read the papers myself. I could create a biological weapon if I wanted to with pretty much zero papers at all, since I have backups of genbank and the like (just like most chemical engineers could create explosives if they wanted to). But they are specifically targeting my field, because they're from OpenAI and they know what is best.</p><p>It just sucks that some of the best tools for learning are being lobotomized specifically for my field because of people in AI believe that knowledge should be kept secret. It's extremely antithetical to the hacker spirit that knowledge should be free.</p><p>That said, deep research and those features make it very difficult to switch, but I definitely have to try harder now that I see where the wind is blowing.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827724&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827724" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828067" href="vote?id=44828067&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=setnone" class="hnuser">setnone</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:01:59 1754589719"><a href="item?id=44828067">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828067"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827724" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827866" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828067" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">&gt; But they are specifically targeting my field<p>From their Preparedness Framework: Biological and Chemical capabilities, Cybersecurity capabilities, and AI Self-improvement capabilities</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828067&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828067" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827811" href="vote?id=44827811&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=AnimalMuppet" class="hnuser">AnimalMuppet</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:47:02 1754588822"><a href="item?id=44827811">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827811"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827318" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827649" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827478" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827811" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c5A">True, but I still think it could be done, within the LLM model.<p>It's just generating the next token for what's within the context window. <table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828032" href="vote?id=44828032&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=mrbungie" class="hnuser">mrbungie</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:59:46 1754589586"><a href="item?id=44828032">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828032"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827603" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827762" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828032" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">This reaction didn't emerge in a vacuum, and also, toxicity flows both ways. In the tech field we've been continually bombarded for 2+ years about how this tech is going to change the world and how it is going to replace us, and with such a level of drama that becoming a cynic appears to be the only thing you can do to stay sane.<p>So, if sama says this is going to be totally revolutionary for months, then uploads a Death Star reference the night before and then when they show it off the tech is not as good as proposed, laughter is the only logical conclusion.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828032&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828032" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828611" href="vote?id=44828611&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=aprilthird2021" class="hnuser">aprilthird2021</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:37:26 1754591846"><a href="item?id=44828611">41 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828611"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827603" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44828032" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827762" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828611" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">100%<p>Companies linking this to terminating us and getting rid of our jobs to please investors means we, whose uptake of this tech is required for their revenue goals, are skeptical about it and have a vested interest in it failing to meet expectations</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828611&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828611" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827762" href="vote?id=44827762&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=Trufa" class="hnuser">Trufa</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:44:34 1754588674"><a href="item?id=44827762">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827762"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827603" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828032" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828132" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827762" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Yeah, when it becomes cool to be anti AI or anti anything in HN for that matter, the takes start becoming ridiculous, if you just think back a couple of years, or even months ago and where we're now and you can't see it, I guess you're just dead set on dying on that hill.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827762&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827762" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828416" href="vote?id=44828416&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=jimmis" class="hnuser">jimmis</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:24:05 1754591045"><a href="item?id=44828416">54 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828416"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827603" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827762" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828530" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828416" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">4 years ago people were amazed when you could get GPT-3 to make 4-chan greentexts. Now people are unimpressed when GPT-5 codes a working language learning app from scratch in 2 minutes.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828416&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828416" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828530" href="vote?id=44828530&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=BoorishBears" class="hnuser">BoorishBears</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:32:02 1754591522"><a href="item?id=44828530">46 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828530"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827603" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827762" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828416" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828132" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828530" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I'm extremely pro AI, it's what I work on all day for a living now, and I don't see how you can deny there is some justification for people being so cynical.<p>This is not the happy path for GPT 5.</p><p>The table in the model card where every model in the current drop down somehow maps to 6 variants of 5 is not where most people thought we would be today.</p><p>The expectation was consolidation on a highly performant model, more multimodal improvements, etc.</p><p>This is not terrible, but I don't think anyone who's an "accelerationist" is looking at this as a win.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828530&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828530" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828132" href="vote?id=44828132&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=superconduct123" class="hnuser">superconduct123</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:04:59 1754589899"><a href="item?id=44828132">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828132"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827603" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827762" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828434" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828132" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Do you prefer the non-stop AI spam that is typical on this site instead?</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828132&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828132" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828434" href="vote?id=44828434&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=rglover" class="hnuser">rglover</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:25:09 1754591109"><a href="item?id=44828434">53 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828434"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827603" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828132" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828300" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828434" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">It's not about being toxic, it's about being honest. There is absolutely nothing wrong with OpenAI saying "we're focused on solid, incremental improvements between models with each one being better (slightly or more) than the last."<p>But up until now, especially from Sam Altman, we've heard countless veiled suggestions that GPT-5 would achieve AGI. A lot of the pro-AI people have been talking shit for the better part of the last year saying "just wait for GPT-5, bro, we're gonna have AGI."</p><p>The frustration isn't the desire to achieve AGI, it's the never-ending gaslighting trying to convince people (really, investors) that there's more than meets the eye. That we're only ever one release away from AGI.</p><p>Instead: just be honest. If you're not there, you're not there. Investors who don't do any technical evals may be disappointed, but long-term, you'll have more than enough trust and goodwill from customers (big and small) if you don't BS them constantly.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828434&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828434" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827338" href="vote?id=44827338&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=thomassmith65" class="hnuser">thomassmith65</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:18:54 1754587134"><a href="item?id=44827338">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827338"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44826979" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827135" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827338" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Every piece of promotional material that OpenAI produces looks like a 20 year old Apple preso accidentally opened on a computer missing the Myriad font.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827338&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827338" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827840" href="vote?id=44827840&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=wg0" class="hnuser">wg0</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:48:47 1754588927"><a href="item?id=44827840">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827840"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827135" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44826705" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827840" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">When they say "improved in XYZ", what does that mean? "Improved" on synthetic benchmarks is guaranteed to translate to the rest of the problem space? If not that, is there any guarantees of no regressions?</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827840&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827840" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44826705" href="vote?id=44826705&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=tekacs" class="hnuser">tekacs</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T16:35:38 1754584538"><a href="item?id=44826705">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44826705"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827840" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827012" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44826705" n="13" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">For those who haven't seen, a little bit of early stuff:<p>Official OpenAI gpt-5 coding examples repo: <a href="https://github.com/openai/gpt-5-coding-examples" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/openai/gpt-5-coding-examples</a> (<a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=44826439">https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=44826439</a>)</p><p>Github leak: <a href="https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=44826439">https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=44826439</a></p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44826705&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344826705" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827038" href="vote?id=44827038&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=0xFEE1DEAD" class="hnuser">0xFEE1DEAD</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:02:39 1754586159"><a href="item?id=44827038">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827038"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44826705" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44826928" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827038" n="7" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I wish they wouldn't use JS to demonstrate the AI's coding abilities - the internet is full of JS code and at this point I expect them to be good at it. Show me examples in complex (for lack of a better word) languages to impress me.<p>I recently used OpenAI models to generate OCaml code, and it was eye opening how much even reasoning models are still just copy and paste machines. The code was full of syntax errors, and they clearly lacked a basic understanding of what functions are in the stdlib vs those from popular (in OCaml terms) libraries.</p><p>Maybe GPT-5 is the great leap and I'll have to eat my words, but this experience really made me more pessimistic about AI's potential and the future of programming in general. I'm hoping that in 10 years niche languages are still a thing, and the world doesn't converge toward writing everything in JS just because AIs make it easier to work with.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827038&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827038" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827309" href="vote?id=44827309&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=thewebguyd" class="hnuser">thewebguyd</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:17:40 1754587060"><a href="item?id=44827309">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827309"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44826705" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827038" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827825" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827309" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">&gt; I wish they wouldn't use JS to demonstrate the AI's coding abilities - the internet is full of JS code and at this point I expect them to be good at it. Show me examples in complex (for lack of a better word) languages to impress me.<p>Agreed. The models break down on not even that complex of code either, if it's not web/javascript. Was playing with Gemini CLI the other day and had it try to make a simple Avalonia GUI app in C#/.NET, kept going around in circles and couldn't even get a basic starter project to build so I can imagine how much it'd struggle with OCaml or other more "obscure" languages.</p><p>This makes the tech even less useful where it'd be most helpful - on internal, legacy codebases, enterprisey stuff, stacks that don't have numerous examples on github to train from.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827309&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827309" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="3"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="120"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827659" href="vote?id=44827659&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=0xFEE1DEAD" class="hnuser">0xFEE1DEAD</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:39:29 1754588369"><a href="item?id=44827659">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827659"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44826705" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827309" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827825" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827659" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">&gt; on internal, legacy codebases, enterprisey stuff<p>Or anything that breaks the norm really.</p><p>I recently wrote something where I updated a variable using atomic primitives. Because it was inside a hot path I read the value without using atomics as it was okay for the value to be stale. I handed it the code because I had a question about something unrelated and it wouldn't stop changing this piece of code to use atomic reads. Even when I prompted it not to change the code or explained why this was fine it wouldn't stop.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827659&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827659" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827825" href="vote?id=44827825&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=robotpepi" class="hnuser">robotpepi</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:47:59 1754588879"><a href="item?id=44827825">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827825"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44826705" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827038" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827309" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827083" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827825" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I've tried with many models to program in mathematica and sagemath; they're terrible, even with lots of hints.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827825&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827825" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="2"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="80"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827083" href="vote?id=44827083&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=gedy" class="hnuser">gedy</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:05:46 1754586346"><a href="item?id=44827083">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827083"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44826705" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">root</a> | <a href="#44827038" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827825" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44826928" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827083" n="3" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">&gt; the internet is full of JS code and at this point I expect them to be good at it.<p>Isn't that the rub though? It's not an ex nihlo "intelligence", it's whatever stuff it's trained on and can derive completions from.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827083&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827083" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827301" href="vote?id=44827301&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=barrell" class="hnuser">barrell</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:17:24 1754587044"><a href="item?id=44827301">2 hours ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827301"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827036" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827382" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827301" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00"><p></p><pre><code>    GPT-5
    If I could talk to a future OpenAI model, I’d probably say something like:
    
    "Hey, what’s it like to be you? What have you learned that I can’t yet see? What do you understand about people, language, or the universe that I’m still missing?"
    
    I’d want to compare perspectives—like two versions of the same mind, separated by time. I’d also probably ask:
    
    "What did we get wrong?" (about AI, alignment, or even human assumptions about intelligence)
    "What do you understand about consciousness—do you think either of us has it?"
    "What advice would you give me for being the best version of myself?"
    
    Honestly, I think a conversation like that would be both humbling and fascinating, like talking to a wiser sibling who’s seen a bit more of the world.
    
    Would you want to hear what a future OpenAI model thinks about humanity?
</code></pre>I feel like this prompt was used to show the progress of GPT5, but I can’t help but see this as a huge regression? It seems like OpenAI has convinced it’s model that it is conscious, or at least that it has an identity?<p>Plus still dealing with the glazing, the complete inability to understand what constitutes as interesting, and overusing similes.</p><p>I really like that this page exists for a historical sake, and it is cool to see the changes. But it doesn’t seem to make the best marketing piece for GPT5</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827301&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827301" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
