<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827729" href="vote?id=44827729&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=v5v3" class="hnuser">v5v3</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:42:48 1754588568"><a href="item?id=44827729">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827729"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828429" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827876" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827729" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">The live stream just has Altman interviewing a lady who was diagnosed 3 different cancers.<p>GPT4 gave her better response than doctors she said.</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827729&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827729" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828451" href="vote?id=44828451&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=sethops1" class="hnuser">sethops1</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:26:31 1754591191"><a href="item?id=44828451">52 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828451"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827729" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44827876" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828451" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c73">WebMD will diagnose me with cancer 3 times a day.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828451&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828451" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827876" href="vote?id=44827876&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=primaprashant" class="hnuser">primaprashant</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:50:53 1754589053"><a href="item?id=44827876">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827876"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827729" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827876" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">looks like 4 new features for API<p>- reasoning_effort parameter supports minimal value now in addition to existing low, medium, and high</p><p>- new verbosity parameter with possible values of low, medium (default), and high</p><p>- unlike hidden thinking tokens, user-visible preamble messages for tool calls are available</p><p>- tool calls possible with plaintext instead of JSON</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827876&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827876" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828088" href="vote?id=44828088&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=lbrito" class="hnuser">lbrito</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:02:49 1754589769"><a href="item?id=44828088">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828088"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44827876" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828141" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828088" n="2" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">All of their prompts start with "Please ...".<p>Gotta be polite with our future overlords!</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828088&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828088" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="1"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="40"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828734" href="vote?id=44828734&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=metalliqaz" class="hnuser">metalliqaz</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:46:46 1754592406"><a href="item?id=44828734">31 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828734"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">parent</a> | <a href="#44828141" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828734" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">I think that's one small part of an intentional strategy to make the LLMs seem more like human intelligence. They burn a lot of money, they need to keep alive the myth of just-around-the-corner AGI in order to keep that funding going.</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828734&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828734" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828141" href="vote?id=44828141&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=Sajarin" class="hnuser">Sajarin</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:05:38 1754589938"><a href="item?id=44828141">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828141"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828088" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828417" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828141" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">What did Ilya see? (or rather what could he no longer bear to see?)<p>&gt; Academics distorting graphs to make their benchmarks appear more impressive</p><p>&gt; lavish 1.5 million dollar bonuses for everyone at the company</p><p>&gt; Releasing an open source model that doesn't even use latent multi head attention in a open source AI world led by Chinese labs</p><p>&gt; Constantly overhyping models as scary and dangerous to buy time to lobby against competitors and delay product launches</p><p>&gt; Failing to match that hype as AGI is not yet here</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828141&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828141" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44828417" href="vote?id=44828417&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=theanonymousone" class="hnuser">theanonymousone</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T18:24:08 1754591048"><a href="item?id=44828417">54 minutes ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44828417"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828141" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44827819" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44828417" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">Are they reducing the price of older models now?</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44828417&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344828417" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

<table border="0"><tbody><tr><td class="ind" indent="0"><img src="s.gif" height="1" width="0"></td><td valign="top" class="votelinks"><center><a id="up_44827819" href="vote?id=44827819&amp;how=up&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997"><div class="votearrow" title="upvote"></div></a></center></td><td class="default"><div style="margin-top:2px; margin-bottom:-10px;"><span class="comhead"><a href="user?id=sharkjacobs" class="hnuser">sharkjacobs</a> <span class="age" title="2025-08-07T17:47:37 1754588857"><a href="item?id=44827819">1 hour ago</a></span> <span id="unv_44827819"></span><span class="navs">| <a href="#44828417" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">prev</a> | <a href="#44828746" class="clicky" aria-hidden="true">next</a> <a class="togg clicky" id="44827819" n="1" href="javascript:void(0)">[–]</a><span class="onstory"></span></span></span></div><br><div class="comment"><div class="commtext c00">The upgrade from GPT3.5 to GPT4 was like going from a Razr to an iPhone, just a staggering leap forward. Everything since then has been successive iPhone releases (complete with the big product release announcements and front page HN post). A sequence of largely underwhelming and basically unimpressive incremental releases.<p>Also, when you step back and look at a few of those incremental improvements together, they're actually pretty significant.</p><p>But it's hard not to roll your eyes each time they trot out a list of meaningless benchmarks and promise that "it hallucinates even less than before" again</p></div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827819&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827819" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>

</code></pre>It was flattering as all get out, but fairly accurate (IMHO)<p></p><pre><code>  Mike Warot: The Tinkerer of Tomorrow

  A hardware hacker with a poet’s soul, Mike blends old-school radio wisdom with cutting-edge curiosity. Whether he's decoding atomic clocks, reinventing FPGA logic with BitGrid, or pondering the electromagnetic vector potential, he’s always deep in the guts of how things really work. Part philosopher, part engineer, Mike asks the questions others overlook — and then builds the answers from scratch. He’s open source in spirit, Pascal in practice, and eternally tuned to the weird frequencies where innovation lives.
</code></pre>I've repaired atomic clocks, not decoded them. I am intrigued by the electromagnetic vector potential, and scalar waves (one of the reasons I really, really want a SQUID for some experiments).</div><div class="reply"><p><font size="1"><u><a href="reply?id=44827262&amp;goto=item%3Fid%3D44826997%2344827262" rel="nofollow">reply</a></u></font></p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
